name: Soy-Ginger Chicken Stir-Fry
description: Tender chicken and crisp vegetables in a savory soy-ginger sauce, served over fluffy cauliflower rice. Comes together in just 15 minutes for a quick and satisfying weeknight meal that's packed with protein and fiber.

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
green onions, sliced (white and light green parts)
frozen riced cauliflower, heated according to package

instructions.description: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and nearly cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, carrots and peppers. Stir-fry for 2 minutes until veggies are crisp-tender.
Add the broccoli, soy sauce and vinegar. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens slightly and coats the chicken and veggies, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve hot over heated cauliflower rice. Garnish with sliced green onions. Enjoy immediately.

name: Thai Peanut Tofu Stir-Fry
description: A flavorful and protein-packed stir-fry with crispy tofu, vegetables, and a creamy peanut sauce.

instructions.description: Press the tofu between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Cut into 1-inch cubes.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sriracha, and 2 tbsp water.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until golden and crispy, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, stir-fry the garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add bell pepper, broccoli, and carrot. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes.
Return tofu to the skillet. Pour in the peanut sauce and toss to coat. Cook for 1-2 minutes until heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.

name: Savory Breakfast Scramble
description: A hearty and nutritious breakfast scramble packed with plant-based protein, fiber, and healthy carbs to fuel your day.

instructions.description: Rinse the red lentils and cook in 1 cup water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain excess liquid.
Press the tofu between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Crumble into small pieces.
Wash and chop the kale, discarding the stems. Dice the onion and red pepper. Mince the garlic.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and pepper, saut√© for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic, paprika and turmeric to the pan. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the kale and a splash of water. Cook until kale is wilted, about 3 minutes.
Add the crumbled tofu, cooked lentils, black salt, black pepper and nutritional yeast. Stir well.
Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through and flavors are melded. Serve hot.

name: Sesame Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: A flavorful and nutritious bowl with sesame chicken, quinoa, and stir-fried vegetables.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper.
Heat sesame oil in a pan and cook chicken until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic and ginger to the pan, and cook for 1 minute.
Add mixed vegetables to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add soy sauce and cooked quinoa to the pan, and stir to combine.
Serve the sesame chicken quinoa bowl hot, topped with sesame seeds.

name: Huevos Rancheros with Quinoa, Avocado and Shrimp
description: A protein-packed twist on the classic Mexican breakfast featuring quinoa, eggs, shrimp, avocado and homemade ranchero sauce.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Set aside and keep warm.
In a blender or food processor, combine garlic, diced tomatoes, chipotles, lime juice, cilantro, salt and pepper. Blend until smooth to make the ranchero sauce.
Heat 1/2 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Season shrimp with salt and pepper, then cook until just opaque, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove shrimp and set aside.
Wipe out skillet. Add remaining 1/2 tbsp olive oil and fry eggs to desired doneness. Season with salt and pepper.
Warm the tortillas. Divide quinoa between them, then top each with a fried egg, shrimp, sliced avocado, and ranchero sauce. Serve immediately.

name: Thai Red Curry Shrimp with Coconut Cauliflower Rice
description: Succulent shrimp bathed in a fragrant Thai red curry sauce, served over fluffy ginger-coconut cauliflower rice. Bursting with authentic flavors and ready in under 30 minutes, this light yet satisfying meal is naturally gluten-free and brimming with anti-inflammatory ingredients.

instructions.description: Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 2-3 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
To the same skillet, add bell pepper and saut√© until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in curry paste and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds.
Pour in coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. Simmer until slightly thickened, 3-4 minutes. Return shrimp to pan and toss to coat. Remove from heat and stir in basil.
Meanwhile, in a separate skillet, saut√© cauliflower rice and grated ginger over medium heat until hot and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste.
Divide cauliflower rice between bowls. Top with shrimp curry. Garnish with green onions. Serve immediately.

name: Chickpea Spinach Curry
description: A flavorful and protein-packed vegetarian curry with chickpeas and spinach.

instructions.description: Dice the onion and mince the garlic and ginger.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saut√© for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic, ginger, curry powder, and cumin. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Drain and rinse the chickpeas, then add them to the skillet along with the diced tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot over rice or with naan bread. Enjoy!

name: Smoked Salmon and Asparagus Quiche with Dill Hollandaise
description: A decadent pescatarian quiche featuring smoked salmon, tender asparagus, and a creamy dill hollandaise sauce. This protein-packed dish is perfect for an indulgent weekend brunch that will impress your guests.

ingredients.name: asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

instructions.description: In a food processor, pulse the flour and cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add the cold water, pulsing until the dough comes together. Form into a disk, wrap in plastic, and chill for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Roll out the chilled dough and fit it into a 9-inch quiche dish. Prick the bottom with a fork and blind bake for 12 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and heavy cream. Stir in the smoked salmon, asparagus, shallot, and 1 tbsp of dill. Pour the mixture into the pre-baked crust.
Bake the quiche for 35-40 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

For the hollandaise, melt the butter in a saucepan. In a blender, combine the egg yolks, lemon juice, and remaining 1 tbsp of dill. Blend on low, slowly drizzling in the hot butter until thickened and creamy. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve the quiche warm, drizzled with the dill hollandaise sauce. Garnish with additional fresh dill if desired.

name: Spicy Pork Mince Burrito Bowl
description: A flavorful and healthy burrito bowl made with lean pork mince, brown rice, black beans, and fresh veggies.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork mince and cook until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add taco seasoning and 1/4 cup water to the skillet. Simmer for 5 minutes until the liquid is absorbed.
In a serving bowl, layer the brown rice, black beans, cooked pork, tomatoes, red onion and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Espresso Ricotta Mousse
description: Indulgent chocolate-espresso mousse with a velvety texture and rich flavor. Prep in advance for a quick treat that satisfies cravings without breaking your diet. Perfect solo or as a shareable dessert.

ingredients.name: monk fruit sweetener (or preferred low-carb sweetener)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: This mousse can be prepped up to 2 days in advance and refrigerated until ready to serve.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the ricotta, heavy cream, cocoa powder, sweetener, espresso powder, and vanilla until very smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes.
Spoon the mousse into a serving glass or bowl. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 days, to allow the flavors to meld.
Before serving, garnish with sugar-free chocolate chips if desired. The mousse should be thick and spoonable. Enjoy within 2 days for best texture.

name: Tofu Scramble Breakfast Bowl
description: A protein-packed vegan breakfast bowl with scrambled tofu, quinoa, kale, and avocado.

instructions.description: Drain the tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Crumble the tofu into small pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add diced onion and saut√© for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Add crumbled tofu, garlic powder, turmeric, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until the tofu is lightly browned.
Add chopped kale to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until wilted.
In a bowl, combine the cooked quinoa and tofu scramble. Top with diced avocado and serve hot.

name: Matcha Mochi Cake with Black Sesame Cream
description: This delightfully chewy mochi cake is infused with earthy matcha and paired with a luscious black sesame cream. Naturally gluten-free and dairy-free, it's a guilt-free indulgence packed with antioxidants and healthy fats.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 4-inch ramekin with oil and line the bottom with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, sift together rice flour, sugar, baking powder and matcha. Whisk to combine.
In another bowl, whisk together coconut milk and avocado oil until smooth. Pour into dry ingredients and stir until just combined, careful not to overmix.
Pour batter into prepared ramekin. Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the edges are lightly browned and the center is set but still jiggly. Let cool completely.
While the cake cools, toast black sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently, until fragrant and lightly popping, about 3-4 minutes. Let cool slightly.
In a food processor or high-speed blender, combine toasted sesame seeds, silken tofu, and maple syrup. Blend until creamy and smooth, scraping down sides as needed. Chill until ready to serve.

Run a knife around the edge of the cooled cake to loosen. Invert onto a plate, peel off parchment, and flip back right-side up. Dust with additional matcha if desired. Serve with a generous dollop of black sesame cream. Enjoy immediately!

name: Matcha Mochi Ice Cream
description: A sophisticated Japanese-inspired paleo dessert with a refreshing matcha flavor and chewy mochi texture.

instructions.description: In a saucepan, combine coconut milk, honey, matcha powder, and vanilla extract. Heat over medium heat, whisking constantly, until the mixture is smooth and hot.
In a small bowl, mix tapioca starch with 60ml of water to form a slurry. Pour the slurry into the saucepan and whisk vigorously until the mixture thickens and becomes glossy, about 2 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a shallow dish and let it cool to room temperature. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set.
Scoop the chilled mixture into small balls using an ice cream scoop. Place the balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 30 minutes.

In a small saucepan, melt the coconut oil over low heat. Dip each frozen matcha ball into the melted coconut oil, ensuring an even coating. Return the coated balls to the baking sheet and freeze for another 10 minutes or until the coating is set.
Serve the matcha mochi ice cream immediately or store in an airtight container in the freezer for up to 1 week.

name: Maple-Glazed Salmon with Wild Rice Pilaf
description: A flavorful salmon dish with a maple glaze, served alongside a hearty wild rice pilaf.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
In a small bowl, mix together the maple syrup and dijon mustard. Brush the mixture over the salmon fillet and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes, or until it easily flakes with a fork.
While the salmon is baking, prepare the wild rice pilaf. In a medium saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

Add the wild rice and vegetable broth to the saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40-45 minutes, or until the rice is tender and has absorbed the liquid.
Stir in the dried cranberries, chopped pecans, salt, and black pepper.
Serve the maple-glazed salmon alongside the wild rice pilaf.

name: Crispy Zucchini Parmesan Chips
description: Satisfy your snack cravings with these crispy, cheesy zucchini chips! Thinly sliced zucchini is coated in Parmesan and herbs, then baked until golden for a healthy, low-carb treat packed with flavor.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Slice the zucchini into thin rounds, about 1/8-inch thick, using a mandolin or sharp knife.
In a small bowl, mix the Parmesan, almond flour, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Place the zucchini rounds on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer. Spray lightly with olive oil.
Sprinkle the Parmesan mixture evenly over the zucchini rounds, pressing gently to adhere.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the zucchini is crispy and golden brown. Serve immediately.

name: Sizzling Fajita Chicken Lettuce Wraps
description: Juicy spice-rubbed chicken, charred peppers and onions, and creamy avocado wrapped in crisp lettuce leaves. An easy, fun, and satisfying meal that's ready in under 25 minutes and great for leftovers too.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, mix chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and 1/2 tsp salt. Slice chicken into thin strips and toss with spice mixture to coat.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, 5-6 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
To the same skillet, add sliced peppers and onions. Cook, stirring often, until vegetables are charred and crisp-tender, 4-5 minutes.
Return chicken to the skillet and stir to combine with vegetables. Cook 1-2 minutes more until heated through. Remove from heat and squeeze a lime wedge over top.
Serve chicken and vegetable mixture inside lettuce leaves, topped with sliced avocado and extra lime wedges on the side. Enjoy immediately while hot.

name: Crispy Sesame-Ginger Tofu Bites
description: Crunchy baked tofu nuggets with an addictive sweet and savory glaze. Enjoy hot from the oven or pack for an protein-rich snack on the go. Perfect for satisfying takeout cravings the healthy way.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Cut the pressed tofu into 3/4-inch cubes and place in a mixing bowl. Sprinkle with cornstarch and gently toss to coat evenly.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, honey, garlic powder and ginger. Pour over the tofu and toss to coat.
Arrange the tofu in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crispy and browned on the edges.
Remove from oven and sprinkle evenly with toasted sesame seeds. Serve warm for maximum crunch, or let cool before storing. Keeps up to 4 days refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Mediterranean Power Bowl with Lemon-Herb Chicken
description: Juicy grilled chicken, fluffy quinoa, and colorful veggies create a satisfying lunch that will power you through the afternoon. Make a big batch on Sunday for grab-and-go lunches all week!

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and let cool.

Season chicken on both sides with oregano, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Heat 1 tsp oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before slicing.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, spinach, feta, and olives.
Diet Hack: For extra flavor without added oil, toast spices in the pan before adding chicken to release their aromatic oils.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, remaining 1 tsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Pour over quinoa mixture and toss to coat.
Divide quinoa salad between bowls or meal prep containers. Top with sliced chicken. Serve cold or at room temperature. Keeps well up to 4 days refrigerated.

name: Smoked Haddock and Spinach Eggs Florentine
description: Indulge in this luxurious twist on a classic brunch dish, featuring flaky smoked haddock, creamy poached eggs, and a velvety hollandaise sauce. Served atop a bed of nutrient-rich spinach, this pescatarian delight is sure to impress and nourish in equal measure.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Place the haddock fillet on a baking sheet and season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Bake for 10-12 minutes until just cooked through.

Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a gentle simmer. Add the white wine vinegar. Crack each egg into a small ramekin. Stir the water to create a vortex and gently slide in the eggs one at a time. Poach for 3-4 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.

In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. In a blender, combine the egg yolks, lemon juice, cayenne, and a pinch of salt. Slowly stream in the melted butter while blending until the sauce is thick and emulsified.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the spinach and saut√© until just wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Split and toast the English muffin. Divide the spinach between the muffin halves. Top each with a piece of haddock and a poached egg. Spoon the hollandaise sauce over the top. Garnish with freshly cracked black pepper. Serve immediately.

name: Smoked Haddock & Chive Souffl√© with Watercress Salad
description: A light and airy smoked haddock souffl√© infused with fresh chives, served alongside a crisp watercress salad. This elegant pescatarian brunch dish is packed with protein and healthy omega-3 fats.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Grease two 8-oz ramekins with butter.
In a saucepan, gently poach the haddock in milk for 8 minutes. Drain, flake fish and set aside. Reserve milk.
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add reserved milk, stirring until thick and smooth.
Remove from heat. Beat in egg yolks one at a time. Stir in haddock, chives, 1/8 tsp salt and pinch of pepper.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold 1/3 of whites into haddock mixture, then fold in remaining.
Divide mixture between ramekins. Bake in a water bath for 20-25 minutes until puffed and lightly browned.
For salad, toss watercress and tomatoes with olive oil, lemon juice, 1/8 tsp salt and pinch of pepper.
Serve souffl√©s immediately with watercress salad on the side. Enjoy!

name: Cinnamon-Vanilla Protein Cheesecake Cups
description: Indulgent single-serve cheesecakes packed with protein and low-carb satisfaction. Make a batch ahead for a week of sweet treats that support your goals.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Line a muffin tin with 4 parchment muffin liners.
In a medium bowl, beat softened cream cheese, protein powder, erythritol, vanilla and cinnamon with an electric mixer until smooth.
Add beaten egg and mix on low just until fully incorporated, about 30 seconds.
Divide batter evenly between the 4 muffin cups. Tap tin gently on the counter to release air bubbles.
Bake for 16-18 minutes until centers are just set. Cool at room temp for 30 min, then chill for at least 2 hours.
Carefully remove parchment liners and serve chilled. Enjoy within 5 days. Make-Ahead Tip: Refrigerate in an airtight container up to 5 days or freeze up to 1 month.

name: Spicy Peanut Stew with Collard Greens
description: A hearty and flavorful vegan African-inspired stew with tender sweet potatoes, protein-rich peanut butter, and nutrient-packed collard greens.

instructions.description: Peel and chop the sweet potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Chop the onion and bell pepper. Mince the garlic and grate the ginger.
In a large pot, saut√© the onion and bell pepper in a little vegetable broth over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 more minute.

Add the sweet potatoes, remaining vegetable broth, peanut butter, tomato paste, cayenne, smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Stir well to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, remove the stems from the collard greens and chop the leaves. After the stew has simmered for 30 minutes, add the collard greens and continue to simmer, uncovered, for 15-20 more minutes until sweet potatoes are tender and greens are wilted.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Serve the stew hot, garnished with chopped peanuts if desired. Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Lamb Meatball Bowls with Creamy Feta Sauce
description: Juicy lamb meatballs seasoned with mint and garlic, nestled in a bowl of crisp lettuce, cucumber, olives and red onion. Drizzled with an irresistible creamy feta sauce for a dish that's low-carb yet immensely satisfying.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, egg, almond flour, garlic, mint, 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp black pepper. Mix until well combined.
Form the mixture into 12 meatballs, about 1.5 inches in diameter. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 18-20 minutes until cooked through and lightly browned.
While the meatballs bake, prepare the salad. In a large bowl, combine the romaine, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and olives. Toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, remaining salt and pepper.
Make the feta sauce: In a food processor or blender, combine the feta, yogurt, lemon juice, and remaining 1 tbsp olive oil. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Divide the salad between two bowls. Top each with 6 meatballs. Drizzle the feta sauce over the top. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Tuna Pita Pockets
description: Refreshing lemony tuna salad tucked into warm whole wheat pita with crisp vegetables. Protein-packed and full of bright Mediterranean flavors, this quick and easy lunch will keep you energized all afternoon.

ingredients.name: canned tuna packed in water, drained
whole wheat pita bread (white pita ok)

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, flake the drained tuna with a fork. Add the diced bell pepper, cucumber, red onion, olives, parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss gently until well combined.
Cut the pita bread in half to form two pockets. Gently open each pocket and stuff with a handful of baby spinach leaves.
Spoon the tuna salad into the pita pockets, distributing it evenly. The pita should be full but not overflowing.
Serve the pita pockets immediately while the bread is still soft and pliable. Enjoy your protein-packed Mediterranean lunch!

name: Spicy Pork Stir-Fry with Bok Choy
description: A flavorful and nutritious stir-fry featuring tender pork, crisp bok choy, and a spicy sauce.

instructions.description: Slice the pork tenderloin into thin strips. Marinate in a mixture of soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced red chili pepper for 20 minutes.
Wash and chop the bok choy into bite-sized pieces. Slice the red bell pepper into thin strips.
Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the marinated pork and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until browned.
Add the bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Add the bok choy and stir-fry until it starts to wilt, about 1-2 minutes.
Mix cornstarch with a little water and add to the wok, stirring until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions if desired.

name: Crispy Chipotle Shrimp Tacos
description: Satisfy your taco cravings with these crispy, spice-rubbed shrimp nestled in warm corn tortillas with fresh pico de gallo. Ready in just 15 minutes, they're perfect for busy weeknights when you need a tasty, protein-packed meal in a flash.

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, mix the chipotle powder, cumin, garlic, and salt. Add the shrimp and toss to coat evenly.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and lightly charred. Transfer to a plate.
Make-Ahead Tip: Pico de gallo can be prepped up to 2 days ahead. In a bowl, mix the tomatoes, onion, cilantro and lime juice. Season with salt to taste.
Warm the tortillas in the microwave under a damp paper towel for 20-30 seconds until pliable.
Diet Hack: Pump up the veggies for volume and vibrant color! Double the pico or add shredded cabbage for crunch without added calories.
Fill each tortilla with shrimp, pico de gallo, and avocado if using. Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

name: Greek Chicken Souvlaki Bowls
description: Juicy grilled chicken skewers served over a crisp Greek salad with creamy tzatziki. Quick to make and packed with bright Mediterranean flavors the whole family will crave. Delicious hot or cold, so it's perfect for meal prep!

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Marinate the chicken. In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces and add to marinade. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes or overnight.
Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Thread marinated chicken onto skewers, discarding excess marinade.
Grill chicken skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning once, until lightly charred and cooked through (internal temp 165¬∞F). Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, feta and olives. Toss gently to mix.
To serve, divide salad between two bowls. Top each with chicken skewers. Drizzle with tzatziki sauce. Enjoy immediately.
Storage: Refrigerate leftover components separately for up to 4 days. Tastes great chilled too!

name: Indonesian Spiced Roasted Chickpeas
description: A flavorful and healthy snack inspired by Indonesian spices, perfect for on-the-go munching.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Drain and rinse the chickpeas, then pat them dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towels.
In a medium bowl, combine the olive oil, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne pepper.
Add the chickpeas to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the spice mixture.
Spread the chickpeas in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Roast the chickpeas in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crisp and golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let the chickpeas cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

name: Moroccan Chickpea Bowl with Spiced Quinoa
description: Savor the exotic flavors of this colorful, protein-packed bowl bursting with aromatic spices and hearty textures. A perfect make-ahead vegan lunch that's budget-friendly and will keep you energized all afternoon.

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, bell pepper, cucumber, onion, and tomatoes.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Pour over the quinoa mixture and toss to coat.
Fold in the baby spinach and parsley until just wilted.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Pack into a portable container and refrigerate until ready to eat.

name: Scandinavian Rye Crisp Crackers with Cucumber and Dill
description: A light, crunchy Scandinavian-inspired snack with whole grain rye crackers topped with fresh cucumber slices and dill.

instructions.description: Thinly slice the English cucumber into rounds.
Finely chop the fresh dill.
Spread 1/2 tbsp of light cream cheese on each rye crisp cracker.
Top each cracker with cucumber slices and sprinkle with chopped dill.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Keto Scandinavian Smoked Salmon Breakfast Bake
description: A high-protein, low-carb breakfast casserole with smoked salmon, eggs, and Scandinavian flavors.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Cut the smoked salmon into bite-sized pieces and arrange them evenly in the prepared baking dish.
Cut the cream cheese into small cubes and scatter them over the smoked salmon.
Pour the egg mixture over the smoked salmon and cream cheese, ensuring even distribution.
Sprinkle the chopped dill and chives over the top of the egg mixture.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Brazilian Steak and Egg Breakfast Skillet
description: A hearty and flavorful high-protein breakfast skillet with Brazilian-style steak, eggs, and vegetables, perfect for a paleo diet.

instructions.description: Slice the steak into thin strips. Dice the bell pepper and onion. Mince the garlic.
In a bowl, mix the steak strips with smoked paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned steak strips and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the diced bell pepper, onion, and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.

Make two wells in the skillet and crack an egg into each well. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the skillet, and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your desired consistency.
Remove the skillet from the heat and serve the steak, vegetables, and eggs hot.

name: Spiced Chickpea Wrap with Tahini Drizzle
description: A satisfying wrap bursting with Middle Eastern flavors and textures. Easily packable for a tasty office lunch that will power you through the afternoon. Pairs well with a simple green salad or crunchy vegetable sticks.

ingredients.name: chickpeas, drained and rinsed (or white beans)
baby spinach (or leafy greens of choice)
whole wheat tortilla or pita (gluten-free if needed)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). On a baking sheet, toss chickpeas with olive oil, paprika, cumin, garlic powder and salt. Roast for 20-25 minutes until crispy.
Make-Ahead Tip: Roasted chickpeas can be prepped up to 4 days in advance. Store in an airtight container at room temp.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice and warm water until smooth and pourable. Set aside.
To assemble, warm the tortilla/pita until pliable. Layer with spinach, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and spiced chickpeas.
Drizzle generously with tahini sauce, wrap tightly and slice in half. Enjoy immediately or wrap in foil for later.
Diet Hack: For extra staying power, add a schmear of hummus inside the wrap. Keeps well for up to 8 hours.

name: Mexican Breakfast Scramble
description: A zesty, high-protein breakfast scramble with Mexican flavors, perfect for a dairy-free diet.

instructions.description: Drain the tofu and press it between two plates with a weight on top for 15 minutes to remove excess water. Crumble the pressed tofu.
Dice the red bell pepper and red onion.
Rinse and drain the black beans.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the crumbled tofu, diced veggies, black beans, taco seasoning and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, for 8-10 minutes until veggies are tender and tofu is lightly browned.
While the scramble cooks, slice the avocado and chop the cilantro.
Serve the hot scramble topped with avocado slices and fresh cilantro. Enjoy immediately!

name: Italian Caprese Protein Bites
description: Satisfying mini caprese skewers packed with protein-rich mozzarella, juicy cherry tomatoes, and fragrant basil. Ready in minutes and perfect for on-the-go snacking or party platters that will impress any crowd.

ingredients.name: fresh mozzarella balls (or cubed fresh mozzarella)

instructions.description: If using large mozzarella balls, cut them into bite-sized cubes, about 3/4-inch each.
Thread a basil leaf, tomato, and mozzarella cube onto a toothpick. Repeat to make 4 caprese skewers.
Arrange the skewers on a plate. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately at room temperature and enjoy!

name: Low-Carb African Dessert Pudding
description: A healthy, low-carb take on a traditional African pudding dessert made with plantains and coconut milk.

instructions.description: Peel the plantains and cut them into small chunks. Place in a pot with the coconut milk.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for about 20 minutes until the plantains are very soft.
Remove from heat and mash the plantains until smooth. Stir in the honey, vanilla, cinnamon and salt.
Pour the pudding into a bowl and allow to cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 1 hour to chill and set.

name: Teriyaki Chicken Bowl
description: A quick and healthy teriyaki chicken bowl perfect for an easy lunch.

instructions.description: Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
Cut chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes.
Add frozen mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until heated through, about 3-4 minutes.
Add teriyaki sauce to the skillet and stir to coat chicken and vegetables. Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce is heated.
Divide cooked brown rice into a bowl. Top with chicken and vegetable mixture. Serve immediately.

name: Spiced Chickpea Pancakes with Mint Chutney
description: Savory and nutritious vegan chickpea pancakes with a refreshing mint chutney, perfect for a leisurely weekend brunch.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together the chickpea flour, water, onion, minced green chili pepper, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt until smooth. Let the batter rest for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the mint chutney by blending the mint leaves, cilantro, lime juice, green chili pepper, and plant-based yogurt in a food processor until smooth. Set aside.

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet and spread it into a thin, round pancake. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve the hot chickpea pancakes with the mint chutney on the side.

name: Spicy Pork Mince Stir-Fry
description: A flavorful and protein-packed stir-fry featuring pork mince, vegetables, and a spicy sauce.

instructions.description: Mince garlic and ginger. Slice red bell pepper and carrot into thin strips. Trim ends off green beans.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic, ginger, and red chili flakes. Saut√© for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add pork mince to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, breaking it up with a spatula, until browned and cooked through.
Add sliced red bell pepper, carrot, and green beans to the skillet. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour in soy sauce and sriracha sauce. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve hot.

name: Spicy Potato and Spinach Kati Rolls
description: Flaky, spiced potato and spinach filling wrapped in homemade paratha flatbreads.

instructions.description: Combine flour and water to make a pliable dough for paratha. Let rest 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, boil potatoes until tender, about 20 min. Mash coarsely.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Toast cumin, then add ginger, chilies, spices and salt. Stir 1 min.
Add mashed potatoes and spinach to spiced oil. Cook until spinach wilts, 3-4 min. Cool.
Divide dough into 6 pieces and roll into circles. Cook in a hot skillet with oil until golden.
Spoon filling onto parathas, add yogurt and cilantro. Roll up tightly and serve warm.

name: Spanish Chicken and Cauliflower Rice Bowl
description: A flavorful and healthy paleo-friendly Spanish-inspired chicken and cauliflower rice bowl.

instructions.description: Cut the chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces. Season with salt, pepper, smoked paprika, cumin, and oregano. Set aside.
Dice the onion and red bell pepper. Mince the garlic cloves.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the diced onion and red bell pepper. Saut√© for 4-5 minutes until softened. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Add the cauliflower rice to the skillet. Cook for 5-6 minutes, stirring frequently, until the cauliflower rice is tender and heated through.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet. Add the lemon juice and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Remove from heat. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley. Serve hot.

name: Grilled Chicken and Quinoa Salad
description: A protein-packed salad featuring grilled chicken, quinoa, arugula, cherry tomatoes and a tangy lime vinaigrette.

instructions.description: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Grill for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through. Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Cook quinoa according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, minced garlic, salt and pepper to make the dressing.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, arugula, halved cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced red onion. Toss with the dressing.
Divide salad between plates and top with sliced grilled chicken. Serve immediately.

name: Indonesian Tempeh Scramble with Sambal
description: Spicy, savory tempeh crumbles with vibrant peppers and traditional sambal sauce. This protein-packed dish will jumpstart your day with exciting Indonesian flavors.

ingredients.name: fresh red chili peppers, minced (or 1 tsp chili flakes)

instructions.description: In a large skillet, heat the coconut oil over medium-high heat until shimmering, about 1 minute.
Add the shallots, garlic, and chili peppers. Saut√© until fragrant and slightly softened, 2-3 minutes.
Crumble the tempeh into the pan. Season with turmeric, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tempeh is lightly browned and crisp around the edges, 4-5 minutes.
Push the tempeh mixture to one side of the pan. Crack the eggs into the empty space and scramble until just set, 1-2 minutes.
Add the diced bell pepper, coconut aminos, and sambal oelek. Stir everything together until well-combined and heated through, 2-3 minutes more.
Remove from heat. Garnish generously with scallions and cilantro. Serve hot with extra sambal on the side, if desired.

name: Chocolate Souffle with Raspberry Sauce
description: A decadent French-style chocolate souffle served with a fruity raspberry sauce.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Butter a 1-cup (250ml) ramekin and coat with sugar. Set aside.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and mix in the flour.
In a saucepan, heat milk until steaming. Slowly whisk into the chocolate mixture until smooth.
Whisk in egg yolks one at a time. Set aside to cool slightly.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with salt until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff and glossy.
Stir a third of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture. Gently fold in the remaining whites.
Pour into prepared ramekin. Level the top. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 12-14 minutes until puffed and set.
Meanwhile, make the raspberry sauce by blending raspberries and water until smooth. Strain out seeds if desired.
Dust the baked souffle with confectioners' sugar. Serve immediately with the raspberry sauce.

name: Greek Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: A flavorful and nutritious grain bowl with Greek-inspired ingredients like chicken, quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, feta and a tangy lemon-herb dressing.

instructions.description: In a serving bowl, add the cooked quinoa, chicken, chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta and parsley. Toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic powder, oregano, salt and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa bowl and toss well to coat everything evenly. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Sesame Ginger Salmon Power Bowl
description: Flaky roasted salmon joins a vibrant medley of crisp vegetables and nutty soba noodles, bathed in an umami-packed sesame ginger dressing. This energizing lunch bowl is meal prep friendly and keeps you full all afternoon.

ingredients.name: buckwheat soba noodles (or whole wheat spaghetti)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Season the salmon with salt and pepper. Place on the prepared baking sheet and roast for 12-15 minutes, until easily flaked with a fork.
Make-Ahead Tip: Roast the salmon and prepare the dressing in advance. Refrigerate for up to 3 days.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the soba noodles and cook according to package directions, adding the broccoli during the last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain and rinse under cold water.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, ginger, and garlic.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked soba noodles, broccoli, bell pepper, carrot, edamame, and green onions. Toss with the sesame ginger dressing.
Flake the roasted salmon into large chunks. Add to the noodle bowl and gently toss.
Garnish with sesame seeds. Enjoy chilled or at room temperature. Stores well refrigerated for up to 4 days.

name: Keto Greek Breakfast Casserole
description: A hearty and flavorful keto-friendly breakfast casserole with Greek-inspired ingredients.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and heavy cream. Crumble in the feta cheese and stir to combine.
Drain the sun-dried tomatoes and roughly chop. Chop the spinach and thinly slice the red onion. Mince the garlic.
Add the sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, red onion, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper to the egg mixture. Stir until well combined.
Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and spread out evenly.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the eggs are set and the top is lightly golden. Let cool for 5 minutes before slicing.

name: Savory Tofu Scramble Breakfast Tacos
description: Protein-packed scrambled tofu with Southwest flavors folded into warm corn tortillas. Make the filling ahead for a quick, satisfying breakfast that keeps you full until lunch.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Prep the tofu scramble filling and refrigerate up to 4 days. Reheat when ready to serve.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add bell pepper and onion. Cook 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add crumbled tofu, taco seasoning, and turmeric (if using). Stir well to combine and cook 4-5 minutes until heated through.
Stir in black beans and cook 1-2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Warm the corn tortillas in the microwave or in a skillet. Fill each with half the tofu scramble.
Top tacos with salsa and avocado slices. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Spiced Chickpea and Tomato Shakshuka
description: A flavorful vegan shakshuka with spiced chickpeas, tomatoes, and silken tofu, perfect for a protein-packed Middle Eastern brunch.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and red bell pepper; cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, coriander, and cayenne pepper; cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chickpeas, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, vegetable broth, salt, and black pepper. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes until slightly thickened.
Create 4 wells in the tomato mixture. Carefully spoon silken tofu into each well. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until tofu is heated through.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot with crusty bread or pita.

name: Russian Buckwheat Pilaf with Mushrooms
description: A hearty and flavorful vegan pilaf dish made with buckwheat, mushrooms, and vegetables.

instructions.description: Rinse the buckwheat groats in a fine mesh strainer until the water runs clear. Set aside.
Dice the onion and carrots. Slice the mushrooms. Mince the garlic.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and carrots and saut√© for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the mushrooms and garlic to the pot. Saut√© for another 5 minutes until the mushrooms release their liquid and begin to brown.
Stir in the buckwheat groats, vegetable broth, bay leaf, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer the pilaf for 20-25 minutes until the buckwheat is tender and has absorbed the liquid.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and fluff the pilaf with a fork.
Stir in the chopped fresh dill. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot.

name: Spicy Chicken & Quinoa Bowl
description: A flavorful and nutritious chicken dish served over protein-packed quinoa

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Season chicken with chili powder, cumin and garlic. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until browned and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Let rest then slice.
Slice bell pepper and zucchini. Saut√© in the same skillet over medium heat until tender-crisp, about 4 minutes.
Divide quinoa between bowls. Top with chicken, peppers, zucchini. Drizzle with lime juice.

name: Cheesy Ham and Spinach Egg Muffins
description: Protein-packed egg muffins loaded with ham, spinach and cheddar cheese for a quick and easy low-carb breakfast.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) and grease a 6-cup muffin tin.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, salt and pepper until well combined.
Roughly chop the spinach. Mix the spinach, diced ham and shredded cheddar into the egg mixture.
Divide the mixture evenly between the muffin cups.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the egg muffins are set and lightly browned on top. Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Ginger-Sesame Tempeh Soba Noodle Bowl
description: Chewy soba noodles and hearty marinated tempeh come together in a gingery sesame sauce for a satisfying protein-packed lunch. Keeps well for meal prep and tastes great hot or cold.

ingredients.name: buckwheat soba noodles (or whole wheat spaghetti)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Whisk together the sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes. Pour over tempeh cubes and marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours.
Cook soba noodles in a pot of boiling water according to package directions until al dente, about 4-5 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.
While noodles cook, heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high. Add marinated tempeh and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and crisp, about 5-6 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine cooked noodles, tempeh, bell pepper, carrots, spinach, and green onions. Toss well to combine.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Diet Hack: Add a drizzle of sriracha for spicy satisfaction without extra calories.

name: Gochujang Tofu Sushi Rolls
description: Spicy and savory tofu sushi rolls with a Korean twist, featuring gochujang chili paste and crunchy vegetables. A flavor-packed and protein-rich vegan snack.

instructions.description: Press the tofu block between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Cut into 1/2-inch thick strips.
In a bowl, mix the gochujang, sesame oil, soy sauce, and rice vinegar to make a marinade. Add the tofu strips and let marinate for 30 minutes.
Cook the sushi rice according to package instructions. Let cool slightly.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat. Spread a thin layer of rice evenly over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Arrange the marinated tofu, carrots, cucumber, and avocado slices in a line across the center of the rice.
Using the sushi mat, carefully roll the nori tightly around the filling. Seal the edge with a bit of water.
Repeat with the remaining nori sheet and ingredients.
Using a sharp knife, slice each roll into 8 pieces. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Serve the gochujang tofu sushi rolls with soy sauce or additional gochujang chili paste for dipping.

name: Grilled Lemongrass Pork Vermicelli Bowls
description: Savory grilled pork infused with lemongrass served over fresh vermicelli noodles, vegetables and herbs.

instructions.description: Remove tough outer layers of lemongrass, mince tender inner core. Mince garlic and shallot. Combine with fish sauce and palm sugar to make a marinade.
Slice pork into thin strips and marinate in lemongrass mixture for 30 minutes.
While pork marinates, prepare vermicelli noodles according to package. Rinse under cold water and set aside.
Julienne cucumber and carrot. Rinse bean sprouts. Pick mint and cilantro leaves. Arrange on serving platter with noodles.
Preheat grill to high heat. Remove pork from marinade and grill 2-3 minutes per side until charred and cooked through.
Slice pork and arrange over vermicelli bowls. Garnish with crushed peanuts and lime wedges. Serve immediately.

name: Lemongrass Tofu Noodle Bowl
description: Delightful Vietnamese-style noodle bowl with lemongrass marinated tofu, fresh vegetables, and rice noodles.

instructions.description: Cut the tofu into 1-inch cubes and set aside. Mince the lemongrass, garlic, and whisk together with soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil to make the marinade. Add tofu cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour.
While the tofu marinates, prepare the noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Julienne the carrots and cucumber. Chop the mint and cilantro.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove tofu from marinade and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Set aside.
To assemble, divide noodles among 6 bowls. Top with tofu, carrots, cucumber, bean sprouts, mint, and cilantro. Garnish with crushed peanuts and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve immediately.

name: Spicy Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A quick and easy stir-fry with tender beef, crisp vegetables, and a spicy kick.

instructions.description: Slice the flank steak against the grain into thin strips. Cut the broccoli into small florets, and slice the bell pepper and carrot into thin strips.
Mince the garlic and ginger. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce and sriracha sauce.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned.
Add the garlic and ginger to the skillet and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the vegetables and continue to stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until they are crisp-tender.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until the sauce is heated through and the beef is cooked to your desired doneness.

name: Quinoa and Black Bean Mini Burrito Bowls
description: Healthy and zesty mini burrito bowls with quinoa, black beans, corn, avocado, and a cilantro lime vinaigrette.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa. In a small pot, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. Add the quinoa, cover, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until the liquid is absorbed.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, avocado, lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, salt and pepper.
Divide the quinoa mixture between 4 small bowls. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later. Garnish with extra cilantro if desired.

name: Paleo Sweet Potato Hash
description: A hearty and healthy paleo breakfast hash with sweet potatoes, eggs, and spinach.

instructions.description: Peel and cut the sweet potato into small cubes. Finely chop the onion and mince the garlic.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sweet potato, onion, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potatoes are tender and lightly browned.
Create two wells in the sweet potato hash and crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your liking.
Add the spinach to the skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted.
Serve the sweet potato hash hot, topped with the cooked eggs and wilted spinach.

name: Vegetable Congee
description: A comforting and nourishing Chinese rice porridge filled with vegetables

instructions.description: Rinse the rice in a fine-mesh strainer until the water runs clear. Add rice, vegetable broth, and water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the rice is very soft and has a creamy consistency, about 12-15 minutes.
Stir in the mushrooms, bok choy, ginger, soy sauce and sesame oil. Simmer for an additional 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Divide the congee between two bowls. Garnish with scallions and serve hot.

name: Vietnamese Tofu Veggie Bowls
description: Flavorful and healthy tofu bowls with fresh vegetables, rice noodles, and a tangy dressing.

instructions.description: Press the tofu block between paper towels to remove excess liquid. Cut into 1-inch cubes.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the tofu cubes until browned and crispy, about 5-6 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
Cook the rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Julienne the carrot, cucumber and red bell pepper into matchstick-sized pieces.
Divide the noodles, tofu and vegetables between two bowls. Garnish with cilantro and lime wedges.
In a small bowl, mix together the hoisin, sriracha, lime juice and salt. Drizzle the dressing over the bowls. Serve immediately.

name: Mediterranean Chicken & Quinoa Power Bowl
description: Savor the flavors of the sunny Mediterranean in this satisfying power bowl packed with juicy chicken, fluffy quinoa, and colorful veggies. Quick to assemble and perfect for meal prep, it's a lunch you'll look forward to all morning.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
While quinoa cooks, whisk together 1 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper in a bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat. Let marinate 10 minutes.
Heat remaining 1/2 tbsp oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 min per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 min before slicing.
Diet Hack: Massage spinach with a little olive oil and salt - it tenderizes it without cooking and adds satisfying richness.
Assemble bowl: Spinach, quinoa, sliced chicken, tomatoes, cucumbers, olives. Drizzle with any remaining marinade. Sprinkle with feta if desired.

name: Chickpea Scramble Breakfast Bowl
description: A high-protein, savory breakfast bowl featuring scrambled chickpea flour 'eggs', saut√©ed veggies, and buttery avocado.

instructions.description: In a bowl, whisk together chickpea flour, water, nutritional yeast, turmeric, salt and pepper until smooth. Let sit for 5 minutes to thicken.
Meanwhile, wash and finely chop the kale, removing any thick stems. Halve the cherry tomatoes. Chop the avocado.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the chickpea batter and cook, stirring frequently, until thick and scrambled, about 5 minutes.
Add the kale and tomatoes to the pan. Saut√© for 2-3 minutes until kale is wilted and tomatoes are softened. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the chickpea scramble and veggies to a bowl. Top with chopped avocado. Serve immediately.

name: Thai Beef Satay Skewers
description: Tender grilled beef skewers marinated in a flavorful Thai-style sauce, served with a creamy almond butter dipping sauce. A protein-packed paleo snack.

instructions.description: Cut the steak into thin strips and place in a bowl.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the coconut aminos, fish sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Pour the marinade over the steak and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning on the grill.
Thread the marinated steak strips onto the skewers.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the skewers for 3-4 minutes per side, until the steak is cooked to desired doneness.
In a small bowl, whisk together the almond butter and coconut milk until smooth. Serve the skewers with the dipping sauce on the side.

name: Cheesy Spinach and Sausage Frittata Muffins
description: Savory, satisfying egg muffins packed with spinach, sausage, and gooey cheese. Perfect for grab-and-go mornings or meal prepping ahead for the week.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin with butter or coconut oil spray.
In a skillet over medium heat, brown the sausage until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Stir in the chopped spinach, browned sausage, and shredded cheese.
Divide the mixture evenly between the muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until puffed and lightly golden on top. A toothpick inserted should come out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Savory Mediterranean Egg Muffins
description: Fluffy, protein-packed egg muffins bursting with sun-dried tomatoes, feta, and spinach. Perfect for a quick snack or grab-and-go breakfast. Freezer-friendly and easy to customize.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin with cooking spray or line with silicone cups.
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs until well combined. Stir in the spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, feta, oregano, salt and pepper.
Divide the egg mixture evenly between the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until the tops are lightly golden and the eggs are set. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the tin.

name: Tofu Gimbap Rolls
description: A veganized version of the classic Korean gimbap rolls, made with marinated tofu, vegetables and brown rice.

instructions.description: Cook brown rice according to package instructions. Set aside to cool.
Wrap tofu in paper towels and press between two plates with a weight on top for 15 minutes to drain excess water. Cut into 7 long strips.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic powder and rice vinegar. Marinate tofu strips in this mixture for 30 minutes.
Julienne the carrots and cucumber. Lightly steam the spinach until just wilted.
On a bamboo sushi mat, place a nori sheet. Spread a thin layer of cooled rice evenly on the sheet, leaving some space at the top edge.
Place a tofu strip and some carrots, cucumber and spinach in the center. Roll the gimbap tightly using the mat. Repeat for remaining ingredients.
Brush rolls with sesame oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Using a sharp knife, slice each roll into bite-sized pieces. Serve immediately.

name: Cardamom Spiced Mango Pudding
description: A light and refreshing dairy-free Indian pudding made with sweet mangoes, coconut milk, and aromatic cardamom.

instructions.description: Peel and chop the mangoes into small cubes. Set aside.

In a saucepan, heat the coconut milk over medium heat. Stir in the agar agar powder, cardamom powder, and vanilla extract. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring continuously, until the agar agar is fully dissolved.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly for 5 minutes.
Pour the mixture into a blender along with the chopped mangoes. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Divide the pudding mixture evenly among 5 serving bowls or glasses. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or until the pudding has set.
Garnish with chopped pistachio nuts before serving.

name: Spicy Chipotle Tofu Scramble Tacos
description: Flavorful scrambled tofu with smoky chipotle, crisp vegetables, and creamy avocado tucked into warm corn tortillas. Meal-prep the filling ahead for an easy, protein-packed breakfast that will power your morning.

ingredients.name: chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced (or chipotle hot sauce)

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper; saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, chipotle, cumin, salt and pepper. Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add crumbled tofu to the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tofu is lightly browned, about 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave until pliable.
Divide the tofu mixture between the tortillas. Top with avocado slices and cilantro. Serve with a lime wedge to squeeze over the top.

name: High-Protein Tuna Lettuce Wraps
description: Healthy gluten-free lettuce wraps filled with protein-packed tuna salad, perfect for a quick snack.

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, mix together the drained tuna, Greek yogurt, celery, red onion, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Spoon the tuna mixture into the center of each lettuce leaf, dividing it evenly.
Fold the lettuce leaves around the tuna mixture to create wraps. Serve immediately.

name: Baked Lemon Herb Salmon with Quinoa and Steamed Broccoli
description: A flavorful and nutritious meal featuring baked salmon seasoned with lemon and herbs, served with quinoa and steamed broccoli.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
Rinse the quinoa and cook it according to package instructions.
Place the salmon fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle the salmon with olive oil and season with minced garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Slice the lemon and place the slices on top of the salmon.
Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through and easily flaked with a fork.
While the salmon is baking, steam the broccoli until tender-crisp.
Serve the baked salmon with the cooked quinoa and steamed broccoli.

name: Crispy Lemon-Caper Chicken with Roasted Broccoli Rabe
description: Juicy chicken cutlets with a golden parmesan crust and bright lemon-caper pan sauce, served alongside tender roasted broccoli rabe. Comes together in under 40 minutes using simple ingredients for a restaurant-quality low-carb meal that's sure to impress.

ingredients.name: almond flour (or finely ground pork rinds)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Toss broccoli rabe with 1 tbsp oil, 1/4 tsp each salt and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast until tender and lightly charred, about 15 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Meanwhile, combine parmesan, almond flour, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper in a shallow dish. Beat the egg in another shallow dish.
Season chicken with remaining 1/4 tsp each salt and pepper. Dip each cutlet in egg, then dredge in parmesan mixture, pressing to adhere.
Heat remaining 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until golden brown and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer to plates.
Add lemon juice, broth and capers to skillet; cook 1 minute. Off heat, swirl in butter. Spoon sauce over chicken. Serve with roasted broccoli rabe.

name: Mexican Chocolate Chia Seed Pudding
description: Indulgent chocolate pudding with a hint of cinnamon spice, thickened with nutrient-packed chia seeds for lasting satisfaction. Whips up in just 5 minutes and chills while you sleep for an effortless treat that's worth waking up for!

ingredients.name: unsweetened almond milk (or milk of choice)
vanilla protein powder (or additional 1 tbsp cocoa)

instructions.description: In a mixing bowl or mason jar, combine all ingredients. Whisk or seal lid and shake vigorously for 30-60 seconds until very well combined.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, ideally overnight. Pudding will thicken as chia seeds absorb liquid.
Before serving, stir pudding to distribute chia seeds. If too thick, thin with a splash of milk. Taste and add more sweetener or cinnamon if desired.
Serve chilled, topped with a sprinkle of cinnamon or drizzle of chocolate if desired, and enjoy your luscious protein-packed treat! Keeps well for 4-5 days refrigerated.

name: Thai Peanut Tofu Lettuce Wraps
description: Flavorful Thai-inspired tofu lettuce wraps with a creamy peanut sauce, perfect as a healthy and protein-packed snack.

instructions.description: Press the tofu for 30 minutes to remove excess moisture. Cut into small cubes.
In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, red curry paste, and honey until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the tofu cubes and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown.
Pour the peanut sauce over the tofu and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Spoon the tofu and sauce mixture into the lettuce leaves. Top with chopped peanuts and cilantro. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Pudding
description: A creamy and indulgent keto-friendly dessert packed with protein and rich chocolate-peanut butter flavor.

instructions.description: In a blender, combine the almond milk, protein powder, peanut butter powder, coconut flour, erythritol, and vanilla extract.
Blend the ingredients on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1-2 minutes.
Pour the mixture into a bowl or individual serving dish.
Refrigerate the pudding for at least 20 minutes to allow it to thicken and chill.
Serve the pudding chilled, optionally topped with a sprinkle of sugar-free chocolate chips or a dollop of sugar-free whipped cream.

name: Crispy Quinoa-Feta Cakes with Roasted Vegetable Salad
description: Satisfyingly crispy quinoa cakes packed with protein and Mediterranean flavors, served over a colorful roasted vegetable salad. Delicious warm or cold, these travel well for workday lunches and can be made ahead for easy meal prep.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan, combine quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer until water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and let cool slightly.

On the lined baking sheet, toss zucchini, bell pepper and onion with 1/2 tbsp olive oil, salt and pepper. Roast 15-20 minutes until tender and lightly browned. Toss with tomatoes and 1/2 tbsp lemon juice.
To the quinoa, add egg, feta, parsley, zest, garlic powder, 1/8 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper. Mix well. Form into 4 patties.
In a large skillet, heat remaining 1/2 tbsp oil over medium heat. Cook patties until golden and crisp, 3-4 minutes per side.
Whisk remaining lemon juice with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss with roasted vegetables. Serve quinoa cakes over salad.

name: High-Protein Vegan Chocolate Shake
description: A delicious and nutritious vegan protein shake with a rich chocolate flavor, perfect for a quick and easy snack.

instructions.description: Add silken tofu, protein powder, almond milk, cocoa powder, pitted dates, and chia seeds to a blender.
Blend all ingredients on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1-2 minutes.
Pour the shake into a tall glass and enjoy immediately.

name: Cheesy Quinoa Protein Bites
description: Savory and cheesy quinoa snacks packed with plant-based protein.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix the cooked quinoa, chickpea flour, cheddar cheese, egg whites, scallions, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl until well combined.
Scoop about 2 tablespoons of the mixture and shape into small patties. Place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the bites are firm and lightly golden. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Sesame Ginger Soba Noodle Salad
description: Chewy buckwheat noodles tossed with crisp vegetables and a tangy sesame ginger dressing. This packable lunch keeps well and tastes great served chilled or at room temperature. Enjoy as a satisfying lunch or light dinner.

instructions.description: Cook soba noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Make-Ahead Tip: Prep the dressing by whisking together sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, ginger and garlic in a small bowl. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine cooked soba noodles, edamame, carrots, bell pepper, and scallions.
Pour the dressing over the noodle mixture and toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Serve chilled or at room temperature. Keeps well for 3-4 days refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken Stir-Fry
description: A flavorful and protein-packed Thai stir-fry with chicken, vegetables, and aromatic basil.

instructions.description: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Mince the garlic and finely chop the bird's eye chili.
Slice the red bell pepper and zucchini into thin strips.
In a wok or large skillet, heat the coconut oil over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and chopped chili to the wok. Stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the chicken pieces to the wok and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until nearly cooked through.
Add the sliced bell pepper and zucchini to the wok. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add the fish sauce and coconut aminos to the wok. Stir to combine and cook for another minute.
Remove the wok from heat and stir in the Thai basil leaves until wilted.
Serve the spicy Thai basil chicken stir-fry hot, accompanied by steamed rice if desired.

name: Gluten-Free Protein-Packed Deviled Eggs
description: A high-protein, gluten-free snack featuring deviled eggs with a creamy, flavorful filling.

instructions.description: Place eggs in a single layer in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.
Drain the eggs and run cold water over them until cool. Peel the eggs and cut them in half lengthwise.
Remove the yolks and place them in a bowl. Mash the yolks with a fork.
Add Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the mashed yolks. Mix until smooth and creamy.
Spoon or pipe the yolk mixture into the egg white halves. Garnish with chopped chives and crumbled bacon.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Grilled Chicken with Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables
description: A healthy and balanced meal with lean protein, complex carbs, and nutrient-rich veggies.

instructions.description: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breast with garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Set aside to rest.
Meanwhile, cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Cut the zucchini, bell pepper, and onion into bite-sized pieces.
Toss the vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill the vegetables for 5-7 minutes or until tender and lightly charred.
Slice the chicken breast and serve with the quinoa and grilled vegetables.

name: Southwest Smoked Salmon Frittata
description: Loaded with smoky flavors and satisfying textures, this protein-packed frittata will keep you full and energized. Prep components ahead for a quick weekend brunch that will wow your guests.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Grease a 9-inch pie dish with olive oil or cooking spray.
Make-Ahead Tip: Prep vegetables. Dice bell pepper and onion, mince jalape√±o, and chop cilantro. Can store in airtight container up to 2 days.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs, salt and pepper until well combined. Gently stir in the smoked salmon, vegetables, spinach, cilantro and cheese.
Pour mixture into the prepared dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the center is set and a knife inserted comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes before slicing.
Diet Hack: Boost satisfaction by serving with sliced avocado, salsa, and a side of fruit. Store leftovers in the fridge up to 4 days - tastes great cold too!

name: Matcha Cheesecake Bites
description: Rich and creamy matcha cheesecake bites topped with a chocolate drizzle, perfect for a keto-friendly Japanese dessert.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Line a 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, beat softened cream cheese, butter, and erythritol until smooth and creamy.
Sift in matcha powder and mix until well combined.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
Fold in almond flour until just incorporated.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
Allow to cool completely, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Melt the sugar-free dark chocolate and drizzle over the chilled cheesecake.
Cut into 16 equal-sized squares and serve.

name: Spicy Chicken Peanut Stew
description: A flavorful and protein-packed African-inspired stew with chicken, vegetables and peanut butter.

instructions.description: Season cubed chicken with salt. Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add onion and bell pepper to the pot. Saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Whisk together broth, peanut butter, tomato paste and cayenne. Pour into the pot and stir.
Return chicken and any juices to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered until thickened and chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Season with salt to taste.

name: Zesty Italian Chicken & Veggie Skillet
description: This vibrant one-pan meal bursts with Italian flavors from juicy chicken, tender vegetables, and herbs. Comes together quickly with minimal cleanup, perfect for busy weeknights. Enjoy as-is or over your favorite pasta.

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces
red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

instructions.description: Season the chicken pieces with salt, pepper, oregano and dried basil. Toss to coat evenly.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
To the same skillet, add the zucchini, bell pepper, onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables are crisp-tender and lightly charred, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the tomatoes and cooked chicken back to the skillet. Cook, stirring gently, until the tomatoes start to burst and release their juices, about 2-3 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Garnish with fresh basil if desired. Serve hot, enjoying the fresh Italian flavors.

name: Spiced Breakfast Cauliflower Hash with Eggs
description: A savory, protein-packed paleo breakfast hash with Indian spices, cauliflower, and baked eggs.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
Cut the cauliflower into small florets. Pulse the florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains.
Heat coconut oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add onion and garlic to the skillet and saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cauliflower rice, garam masala, turmeric, salt and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the cauliflower is tender.
Create 5 wells in the hash and carefully crack an egg into each well. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the egg whites are set and yolks reach desired doneness.
Remove from oven, garnish with fresh cilantro, and serve hot.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a flavorful quinoa filling, featuring Mediterranean ingredients like tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Rinse the quinoa thoroughly under cold water. In a pot, combine the quinoa and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Cut the bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes. Place the peppers cut-side up on the prepared baking sheet.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Saut√© the diced onion for 5 minutes until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Add the cooked quinoa, halved cherry tomatoes, chopped olives, chopped parsley, feta cheese, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine and heat through.
Spoon the quinoa mixture into the bell pepper halves, pressing down gently to fill them completely.
Bake the stuffed peppers for 25-30 minutes until the peppers are tender and lightly browned on the edges. Serve hot.

name: Honeyed Baklava-Spiced Yogurt Bowl
description: Creamy Greek-style coconut yogurt infused with the flavors of baklava - honey, walnuts, cinnamon and cloves. Topped with crunchy granola, fresh berries, and a drizzle of agave, this easy dessert bowl satisfies your sweet tooth while packing in plant-based protein and fiber.

instructions.description: In a bowl, stir together the coconut yogurt, protein powder, 2 tsp honey, cinnamon, and cloves until smooth. Taste and add more honey if desired.
Toast the walnuts in a dry skillet over medium heat for 3-5 minutes, until fragrant and lightly browned. Cool slightly.
Spoon the spiced yogurt into a serving bowl. Top with granola, berries, and toasted walnuts. Drizzle with the remaining 1 tsp honey. Enjoy immediately!

name: Spanish Shrimp and Chickpea Stew
description: A hearty and flavorful Spanish-style stew with shrimp, chickpeas, and vegetables.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and red bell pepper; saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and smoked paprika; cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
