Stir in diced tomatoes, chickpeas, and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add shrimp and spinach to the pot. Cook until the shrimp are pink and the spinach is wilted, about 3-4 minutes.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Crispy Edamame-Quinoa Bites with Spicy Ginger Dip
description: Crunchy, protein-packed bites bursting with Asian flavors, perfect for satisfying afternoon cravings. Make a batch ahead for grab-and-go snacking all week. Pairs perfectly with a spicy-sweet ginger dipping sauce.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, mix quinoa, edamame, carrot, panko, green onion, 2 tsp tamari, sesame oil, 1/2 tsp ginger and egg until well combined.
Shape mixture into 10 compact balls, about 2 tablespoons each. Place on prepared baking sheet.
Bake 20-22 minutes, until firm and lightly browned. Let cool 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk remaining 1 tsp tamari, 1/2 tsp ginger, garlic, sriracha and vinegar for the dipping sauce.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa-Stuffed Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a savory blend of quinoa, ground turkey, olives and feta. Prep ahead for a satisfying grab-and-go lunch that tastes great hot or cold.

ingredients.name: bell peppers, halved and seeded (any color)
ground turkey (sub ground chicken or crumbled tempeh)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Place pepper halves cut-side up in a baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes, until tender but not mushy.
Meanwhile, combine quinoa and broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
While quinoa cooks, brown turkey in a skillet over medium heat, breaking up chunks, about 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic; saut√© until softened, 3-4 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes with juices, olives, parsley, oregano and lemon juice. Simmer 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Fluff quinoa with a fork. Mix into the turkey mixture. Spoon filling into pepper halves. Top with feta.
Return to oven and bake 10 more minutes, until peppers are very tender and filling is heated through. Serve warm or at room temperature. Keep refrigerated up to 4 days.

name: Fiesta Roasted Chickpea Snack Mix
description: Addictively crunchy roasted chickpeas tossed with zesty Mexican spices, pepitas, and chewy dried mango. This protein-packed snack mix satisfies cravings and keeps you energized for hours. Batch it up for a week of healthy, grab-and-go fuel.

ingredients.name: chickpeas, drained and rinsed (or white beans)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Make-Ahead Tip: Prep can be done up to 3 days in advance. Store in an airtight container in the fridge.
Drain and rinse chickpeas. Pat very dry with paper towels or a clean dish towel.
In a medium bowl, toss chickpeas with olive oil and spices until evenly coated.
Spread chickpeas in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20-30 minutes, shaking the pan halfway through, until crispy and lightly browned.
Diet Hack: Dry roasting brings out the spices' flavor without added oil.
While chickpeas roast, combine pepitas and dried mango in a serving bowl.
Let chickpeas cool for 5 minutes, then add to the bowl and toss to combine. Enjoy warm or at room temp.
Storage: Keeps 5 days in an airtight container at room temperature. Re-crisp in a 350¬∞F oven for 5 minutes if needed.

name: Thai Basil Tofu Scramble with Sticky Rice
description: A flavorful and protein-packed Thai-style tofu scramble served with sticky rice for a satisfying breakfast.

instructions.description: Soak the sticky rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and steam for 20 minutes until cooked.
Drain the tofu and press between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Crumble into small pieces.
Mince the shallot and garlic. Slice the red bell pepper into thin strips. Roughly chop the Thai basil leaves.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saut√© shallot and garlic for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add crumbled tofu, red bell pepper, soy sauce, sriracha, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the chopped Thai basil leaves and cook for another minute. Remove from heat.
Serve the tofu scramble alongside the steamed sticky rice. Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Tuna Salad
description: A bright and satisfying salad featuring protein-rich quinoa and tuna, crisp vegetables, and a zesty lemon dressing. Loaded with fiber, healthy fats, and fresh Mediterranean flavors in every bite.

ingredients.name: solid white albacore tuna in water, drained and flaked

instructions.description: In a small saucepan, combine the quinoa and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, Dijon, garlic, salt and pepper until emulsified.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, flaked tuna, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, olives and parsley. Drizzle with the dressing and toss gently to coat.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve slightly warm or chilled. Salad can be made up to 4 hours ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Mediterranean Chicken Skillet with Feta-Olive Topping
description: This flavorful one-pan chicken dish features tender saut√©ed chicken breasts topped with a briny, creamy feta and olive mixture. With zucchini noodles and grape tomatoes cooked right in, it's a complete meal that satisfies without weighing you down.

instructions.description: Pat the chicken breasts dry with paper towels. Season both sides with salt, pepper, and half of the oregano.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.

Add the remaining olive oil to the skillet. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the zucchini noodles, tomatoes, remaining oregano, salt and pepper. Saut√© until the noodles are al dente and the tomatoes start to burst, about 3-4 minutes.
While the vegetables cook, mix the feta and chopped olives in a small bowl.
Nestle the chicken back into the skillet with the vegetables. Spoon the feta-olive mixture evenly over the chicken. Cover and let the feta melt slightly, about 2 minutes.
Divide between plates and serve immediately. Enjoy this fresh taste of the Mediterranean!

name: Mediterranean Chicken Skillet with Feta-Olive Topping
description: This flavorful one-pan chicken dish packs in satisfying protein, healthy fats, and zesty Mediterranean flavors. Quick to make but impressive enough for guests, it's sure to become a weeknight staple you'll crave.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate 10-30 minutes if time allows.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until golden and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
To the same skillet, add tomatoes, artichokes, and olives. Cook until heated through and slightly thickened, about 3-4 minutes.
Return chicken to pan and spoon tomato mixture on top. Sprinkle with feta and parsley. Serve hot with a side salad or steamed low-carb veggies like broccoli or zucchini.

name: Matcha-Sesame Panna Cotta with Ginger Syrup
description: Silky smooth green tea panna cotta infused with nutty sesame, topped with a spicy-sweet ginger syrup. This restaurant-quality, portion-controlled dessert is packed with antioxidants and healthy fats for guilt-free indulgence.

ingredients.name: black and white sesame seeds, for garnish

instructions.description: Pour almond milk into a small bowl and sprinkle gelatin on top. Let stand for 5 minutes to allow gelatin to absorb the liquid.
In a small saucepan, combine heavy cream, matcha powder, sesame oil, and 1 tbsp erythritol. Heat over medium, whisking constantly, until barely simmering, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat and whisk in the almond milk-gelatin mixture until gelatin is fully dissolved. Pour through a fine mesh strainer into a measuring cup.
Lightly grease a 6 oz ramekin with neutral oil. Pour the panna cotta mixture into the ramekin. Refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours or overnight.

For the ginger syrup, combine remaining 1 tbsp erythritol with 2 tbsp water in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 30 seconds until erythritol dissolves. Stir in grated ginger and lemon juice.
To unmold, run a thin knife around the edge of the panna cotta. Dip the ramekin in hot water for 10 seconds. Invert onto a serving plate and shake gently to release.
Spoon the ginger syrup over the panna cotta. Garnish with a sprinkle of black and white sesame seeds. Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Saffron-Spiced Couscous Salad with Crispy Chickpeas
description: This colorful couscous salad is bursting with bright flavors and crunchy textures. Filled with plant-based protein and fiber, it's a satisfying lunch that tastes great at any temperature and keeps you energized all afternoon.

ingredients.name: whole wheat pearl couscous (or regular couscous)
Persian cucumber, diced (or 1/2 cup diced cucumber)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Couscous can be cooked 2-3 days ahead and stored in the fridge.

In a medium saucepan, bring vegetable broth and saffron to a boil. Stir in couscous, cover, and remove from heat. Let stand until liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside to cool slightly.

Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Pat chickpeas dry with a paper towel, then add to the skillet. Season with smoked paprika, 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until crispy and golden brown, 8-10 minutes. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine cooled couscous, crispy chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, roasted peppers, olives, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic, 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper. Pour over couscous mixture and toss to combine.
Serve at room temperature or chilled. Keeps well in the fridge for up to 4 days. To pack for lunch, store in individual airtight containers.

name: Savory Egg Custard Breakfast Bowls
description: Silky egg custard baked inside crispy prosciutto cups and topped with garlicky saut√©ed spinach and mushrooms. A decadent, high-protein breakfast.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Liberally grease 4 small ramekins.
In a medium bowl, whisk eggs, cream, Parmesan, salt and pepper until smooth. Set aside.
Gently press a slice of prosciutto into each ramekin to form a cup. Pour egg mixture into each cup.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until custards are puffed and set. Let cool 10 minutes before unmolding.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© mushrooms until browned, 5-7 minutes.
Add spinach and minced garlic. Cook until spinach is wilted and garlic is fragrant, 1-2 minutes more. Season with salt & pepper.
Carefully unmold custards onto serving plates. Spoon warm mushroom-spinach topping over each. Serve immediately.

name: Tuscan White Bean & Tuna Bowls
description: Hearty Italian-inspired bowls packed with protein-rich tuna and creamy cannellini beans tossed with garlicky spinach and sun-dried tomatoes. Ready in under 25 minutes using pantry staples for a family-friendly weeknight meal.

ingredients.name: cannellini beans, rinsed and drained (or other white beans)
jarred sun-dried tomatoes, drained and chopped
canned tuna in water, drained and flaked (or canned salmon)

instructions.description: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the spinach to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until wilted and bright green, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the drained cannellini beans, sun-dried tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Gently fold in the flaked tuna and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until warmed. Drizzle with red wine vinegar and toss to coat evenly.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Divide among bowls and serve immediately. Enjoy!

name: Grilled Chicken with Quinoa Salad
description: A protein-packed meal with grilled chicken and a refreshing quinoa salad.

instructions.description: Preheat the grill or a grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breast with garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
In a bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and olive oil. Pour the dressing over the quinoa salad and toss to combine.
Serve the sliced grilled chicken on top of the quinoa salad.

name: Mexican Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
description: Flavorful and hearty bell peppers filled with a Mexican-inspired quinoa mixture, topped with melted cheese.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Rinse the quinoa and cook according to package instructions.
Cut the bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, salsa, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder.
Fill each bell pepper half with the quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and sprinkle cheese on top of each pepper.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Pistachio Rose Baklava Rolls
description: Delicate phyllo rolls filled with aromatic pistachio, rose water and spices, lightly sweetened with date syrup. A dairy-free and decadent middle-eastern dessert.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
In a bowl, mix the chopped pistachios, almond flour, cinnamon, and cardamom.
Lay out a sheet of phyllo dough and brush with olive oil. Place another sheet on top and repeat until you have 4 layers.
Spread a thin layer of the pistachio mixture over the phyllo, leaving a 1 cm border. Drizzle with 1 tbsp of date syrup and 1 tsp of rose water.
Carefully roll up the phyllo tightly, brushing the outer layer with more olive oil. Cut into 4 equal pieces.
Repeat steps 3-5 with the remaining ingredients to make 4 rolls total. Place the rolls on the baking sheet.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until golden brown and crispy. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Drizzle the rolls with the remaining date syrup and rose water before serving.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Power Bowl
description: This colorful, protein-packed quinoa bowl is bursting with Mediterranean flavors. It's easy to prep ahead for a week of filling lunches that you'll look forward to all morning. Pairs perfectly with a side of hummus and pita chips for an extra satisfying midday meal.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook quinoa by combining rinsed quinoa and broth in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered until liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, olives, feta, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, za'atar, salt and pepper. Pour over quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Diet Hack: For a protein boost, top with a dollop of hummus before serving. Keeps well refrigerated up to 4 days.

name: Brazilian Beef Breakfast Skillet
description: A hearty and flavorful paleo breakfast skillet with Brazilian flavors, packed with protein and healthy fats.

instructions.description: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and cook, stirring and breaking up the meat, until browned, about 5 minutes.

Add the onion, garlic, tomatoes, and bell pepper to the skillet. Stir in the smoked paprika, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Make two wells in the beef mixture and crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and cook until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny, about 3-4 minutes.
Sprinkle the cilantro over the skillet. Serve the breakfast skillet hot, topped with sliced avocado.

name: Mexican Pork Mince Lettuce Wraps
description: Spicy pork mince served in fresh lettuce leaves with tomato salsa and avocado.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika and chili powder. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add pork mince and cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Stir in black beans and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, dice tomato and avocado. Mix with chopped cilantro and lime juice.
Spoon pork mixture into lettuce leaves. Top with tomato avocado salsa. Serve immediately.

name: Crispy Mozzarella Zucchini Fritters
description: Savory and crispy keto-friendly fritters made with zucchini and mozzarella cheese, perfect for a satisfying Mediterranean-style snack.

instructions.description: Grate the zucchini and squeeze out excess moisture using a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth.
In a large bowl, combine the grated zucchini, mozzarella cheese, almond flour, egg, minced garlic, chopped basil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until a thick batter forms.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Scoop about 1/4 cup of the zucchini mixture for each fritter and carefully place it in the hot skillet. Flatten the fritters slightly with the back of a spoon.
Cook the fritters for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and crispy. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
Serve the crispy mozzarella zucchini fritters warm with a side of sugar-free marinara sauce or Greek yogurt dip, if desired.

name: Lemon-Herb Chicken Pita Pockets
description: Juicy lemon-marinated chicken tucked into whole grain pita with crunchy veggies and tangy yogurt sauce. A satisfying handheld lunch that's easy to make ahead and pack for busy days.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: In a bowl, whisk together lemon juice, garlic, oregano and olive oil. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate 30 minutes, or overnight for more flavor.
Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 4-5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (165¬∞F internal temp). Let rest 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
In a small bowl, mix yogurt and dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cut pita in half to form pockets. Fill each half with sliced chicken, tomato, cucumber, red onion, and a dollop of dill yogurt sauce.

name: Kale, Mushroom and Turkey Sausage Scramble
description: A high-protein, low-carb breakfast scramble packed with kale, mushrooms and turkey sausage.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add turkey sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms to the pan and cook until softened, about 3 more minutes. Add kale and cook until wilted, 1-2 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, egg whites, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the sausage and vegetables.
Cook, stirring frequently, until the eggs are set and scrambled to your desired consistency, about 3-4 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Italian Sausage & Veggie Breakfast Scramble
description: A hearty, flavorful breakfast scramble packed with savory Italian sausage, colorful vegetables, and creamy dairy-free cheese. Prep the ingredients ahead for a quick, high-protein morning meal that will power your day.

ingredients.name: dairy-free Italian sausage (or sub regular pork sausage)
dairy-free shredded mozzarella (or sub regular if not dairy-free)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Chop the sausage and vegetables up to 3 days in advance and store in the fridge.
Preheat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook, breaking it up with a spatula, until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes.
Add the bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender-crisp, about 3 minutes.
Add the spinach and cook until just wilted, 1-2 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs with the salt and pepper. Pour into the skillet with the sausage and vegetables. Cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are softly set, 2-3 minutes.
Sprinkle the cheese and basil over the top. Cover and let melt for 1 minute. Serve hot, with hot sauce if desired. Keeps up to 3 days refrigerated.

name: Grilled Chicken and Quinoa Bowl
description: A healthy and satisfying dinner bowl with grilled chicken, quinoa, and vegetables.

instructions.description: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season chicken with garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Steam broccoli florets until tender-crisp.
Slice red bell pepper into thin strips.
In a serving bowl, combine cooked quinoa, steamed broccoli, and sliced bell pepper.
Top with sliced grilled chicken.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with additional salt and pepper if desired.

name: Mediterranean Salmon-Spinach Frittata Muffins
description: Fluffy, protein-packed mini frittatas bursting with fresh Mediterranean flavors. Perfect for make-ahead brunches or busy mornings. Pair with a side salad for a satisfying meal.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 6-cup muffin pan with oil spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt, pepper, and dill until fluffy.
Gently fold in the spinach, salmon, feta, sun-dried tomatoes, and scallions.
Divide the mixture evenly between the muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until puffed and lightly golden. A toothpick inserted should come out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A quick and easy Asian-inspired stir-fry with tender beef, crisp vegetables, and a flavorful sauce.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add sliced beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Add broccoli, bell pepper, and carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Pour the sauce mixture into the skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and vegetables.
Serve hot over cooked brown rice.

name: Thai Curry Chicken Meatballs
description: Flavorful and protein-packed Thai-inspired chicken meatballs with a coconut curry sauce, perfect for a satisfying paleo snack.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, mix the ground chicken, green onion, cilantro, red curry paste, fish sauce, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Shape the mixture into 12 meatballs, each about 2 inches in diameter.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook the meatballs for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the coconut milk and lime juice. Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour the coconut curry sauce over the meatballs and let simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve the meatballs hot, garnished with extra cilantro if desired.

name: Spicy Chicken Avocado Wrap
description: A healthy and satisfying wrap filled with seasoned chicken, creamy avocado, and fresh veggies.

instructions.description: Season the chicken with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Let it rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
In a small bowl, mash the avocado with lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Thinly slice the bell pepper and red onion.
Lay out the tortilla and spread the mashed avocado in the center. Top with sliced chicken, bell pepper, onion, and spinach.
Fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then roll up tightly. Cut in half and serve.

name: Savory Keto Waffle Sandwich
description: A hearty and flavorful keto brunch sandwich featuring a chaffle waffle, fried egg, bacon, avocado, and spinach.

instructions.description: Preheat a waffle iron. Mix together the almond flour, 80g mozzarella, 40g cream cheese, 2 eggs, salt and pepper in a bowl until a thick batter forms.
Pour half the batter in the waffle iron and cook until crisp and browned, about 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter to make a second chaffle. Let cool slightly.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Fry the remaining 4 eggs in the bacon fat.
Split and toast the chaffles. Mash the avocado and remaining cream cheese together and spread on the bottom chaffle halves.
Top each with spinach leaves, 2 fried eggs, bacon slices and the remaining mozzarella. Close the sandwiches with the top chaffles.
Place the sandwiches back in the waffle iron and cook until the mozzarella is melted and sandwiches are hot, about 2 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
description: A delicious and nutritious chicken dish packed with spinach, feta, and quinoa.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
In a bowl, mix the spinach, feta, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Cut a pocket into the side of each chicken breast.
Stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear the stuffed chicken breasts for 2-3 minutes per side.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes.
Serve the stuffed chicken breast with quinoa on the side.

name: Proven√ßal Tomato Tartines
description: Toasted bread slices topped with a flavorful tomato, olive and herb mixture, for a light and healthy French-inspired snack.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F).
Slice the baguette diagonally into 10 pieces, each about 1.5 cm (1/2 inch) thick.
Brush each slice with olive oil on both sides and arrange on a baking sheet. Toast in the preheated oven for 8-10 minutes, until lightly golden and crisp.
In a bowl, mix together the diced tomatoes, chopped olives, minced garlic, chopped basil, remaining olive oil, salt and pepper.
Spoon the tomato mixture evenly over the toasted baguette slices. Serve immediately.

name: Matcha Green Tea Coconut Ice Cream
description: Indulge in this creamy, antioxidant-rich matcha green tea ice cream made with nourishing coconut milk. Lightly sweetened with honey, it's a guilt-free treat that satisfies your sweet tooth while providing beneficial nutrients.

instructions.description: In a blender, combine the coconut milk, honey, matcha powder, and vanilla extract. Blend until smooth and well combined.
Pour the mixture into a freezer-safe container and place in the freezer for 2 hours, stirring every 30 minutes to break up ice crystals and ensure a creamy texture.
After 2 hours, the ice cream should be firm but scoopable. If it's too hard, let it soften at room temperature for a few minutes before scooping and enjoying!

name: Sausage, Spinach & Mushroom Frittata Muffins
description: Savory, cheesy frittata muffins packed with flavorful sausage, tender spinach and umami mushrooms. Perfect for grab-and-go mornings or weekend brunch, these reheat beautifully so you can meal prep ahead.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with silicone liners.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook sausage until browned, breaking up with a spoon, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until softened, 3-4 minutes more. Stir in spinach and cook until just wilted, 1 minute. Remove from heat.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, salt and pepper until well combined. Stir in sausage mixture, cheddar and Parmesan.

Divide mixture evenly between muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Bake until puffed and lightly golden on top, 20-25 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Make-Ahead Tip: Refrigerate in an airtight container up to 4 days or freeze up to 1 month. Reheat gently in the microwave.

name: Crispy Parmesan Zucchini Bites
description: Savory and satisfying, these cheesy zucchini rounds are oven-baked until golden and crisp. Perfect for afternoon snacking or as a party appetizer that everyone will enjoy.

ingredients.name: almond flour (or finely crushed pork rinds)

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a shallow bowl, mix together the Parmesan, almond flour, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Dip each zucchini round into the Parmesan mixture, coating both sides and pressing gently to adhere. Place the coated rounds on the prepared baking sheet.
Lightly spray the tops of the zucchini with olive oil spray. Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Enjoy as is or with your favorite low-carb dipping sauce.

name: Matcha Mochi Bites with Azuki Bean Filling
description: Chewy, lightly sweetened matcha mochi balls filled with creamy azuki bean paste. Naturally gluten-free and dairy-free, these portion-controlled bites deliver an antioxidant boost with earthy matcha and protein-packed azuki beans.

instructions.description: In a microwave-safe bowl, whisk together the sweet rice flour and matcha powder until evenly distributed.

Drain the silken tofu, reserving 3 tablespoons of the liquid. Mash the tofu until smooth, then stir into the flour mixture along with the maple syrup until a sticky dough forms. Add reserved tofu liquid 1 teaspoon at a time if needed for dough to come together.

Dust your hands and work surface liberally with starch. Divide the dough into 6 equal pieces and roll each into a ball. Flatten into a disc, then place 1 rounded teaspoon of azuki paste in the center. Pinch and pleat the edges to seal completely. Re-roll into a smooth ball.
Place filled mochi on a parchment-lined plate dusted with starch. Microwave on high for 1 minute. Let cool for 2-3 minutes until set but still soft and pillowy.
Dust with additional starch and serve warm, or chill if a firmer texture is desired. Best enjoyed within 1-2 days.

name: Lemon Garlic Chicken with Quinoa and Broccoli
description: A flavorful and nutritious chicken dish with quinoa and broccoli, perfect for a satisfying lunch.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
In a small bowl, mix together lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, black pepper, paprika, and dried oregano to create a marinade.
Place the chicken breast in a baking dish and pour the marinade over it, making sure the chicken is evenly coated. Let it marinate for 15 minutes.
In a medium saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until the quinoa is tender and has absorbed the water.
Place the marinated chicken in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165¬∞F (74¬∞C).
While the chicken is baking, steam the broccoli florets for 5-7 minutes or until tender-crisp.
Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve the sliced lemon garlic chicken with quinoa and steamed broccoli.

name: Quinoa Tuna Salad
description: A protein-packed, nutritious quinoa salad with tuna, vegetables, and a zesty lemon dressing.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Allow to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, drained tuna, halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, and finely chopped red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss well to combine. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Creamy Chocolate Protein Pudding
description: A rich, creamy chocolate pudding packed with protein for a satisfying and healthy snack.

instructions.description: Drain the silken tofu and place it in a blender or food processor.
Add the cocoa powder, protein powder, maple syrup, and vanilla extract to the blender.
Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed.
Pour the pudding into a bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to chill and set.
Serve the pudding cold, garnished with fresh berries or a sprinkle of cocoa powder, if desired.

name: Matcha Tofu Cheesecake
description: A delicious and healthy keto-friendly Japanese-inspired matcha tofu cheesecake.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F). Grease a 15 cm (6-inch) springform pan with butter.
In a food processor, blend the silken tofu, cream cheese, matcha powder, erythritol, and vanilla extract until smooth.
In a separate bowl, mix the coconut flour and melted butter until well combined. Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan to form a crust.
Pour the matcha tofu mixture into the pan over the crust. Tap the pan gently on the counter to remove any air bubbles.
Bake the cheesecake for 50-60 minutes, or until the center is set but still slightly jiggly.
Allow the cheesecake to cool at room temperature for 30 minutes, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Tuna Quinoa Power Bowl
description: A protein-packed quinoa bowl with tuna, avocado, and mixed veggies for a satisfying and nutritious lunch.

instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, drained tuna, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and diced red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa and tuna mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl and top with sliced avocado.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad with Grilled Vegetables
description: A protein-packed, dairy-free quinoa salad with grilled vegetables and Mediterranean flavors.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa thoroughly. In a pot, bring 2 parts water to a boil. Add 1 part quinoa, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and let cool.

Slice the bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion into 1-inch pieces. Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and minced garlic. Grill the vegetables on high heat until slightly charred and tender, about 10-15 minutes. Let cool.
In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, grilled vegetables, halved cherry tomatoes, and chopped parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, remaining olive oil, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa salad and toss to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Nordic Skyr Barley Porridge with Berry Compote
description: A hearty and healthy vegan Scandinavian-inspired breakfast porridge made with skyr and barley, topped with a vibrant berry compote.

instructions.description: In a small saucepan, combine the frozen berries and pitted dates. Cook over medium heat until berries soften and release their juices, about 8-10 minutes. Mash lightly with a fork, stir in vanilla extract, and set aside.
In a separate saucepan, combine the skyr, cooked barley and water. Heat over medium, stirring often, until heated through and thickened to desired consistency, about 5-6 minutes.
Transfer the barley porridge to a serving bowl. Top with the berry compote, almond flakes, and a sprinkle of chia seeds. Serve immediately.

name: Cajun Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: A zesty and protein-packed Cajun chicken quinoa bowl with black beans and saut√©ed veggies.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa and cook according to package directions. Set aside.
Rinse and drain the black beans. Slice the bell pepper and zucchini.
Season the chicken with 1 tsp Cajun seasoning, garlic powder and salt.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 4-5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through. Transfer to a plate.
To the same skillet, add the peppers and zucchini. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tsp Cajun seasoning. Saut√© for 5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Slice the chicken. Divide the quinoa between bowls and top with black beans, veggies and sliced chicken. Serve warm.

name: Spiced Plantain and Black-Eyed Pea Fritters
description: Savory fritters made with mashed plantains and black-eyed peas, flavored with aromatic spices. Served with a spicy tomato-onion relish.

instructions.description: Peel and mash the ripe plantains in a large bowl. Mash the black-eyed peas and add to the bowl.
Finely chop the onion, garlic and ginger. Add to the bowl along with coriander, cumin, cayenne, chickpea flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well to form a thick batter.
Heat a few tablespoons of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Spoon 1/4 cup of batter per fritter into the pan. Fry for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
For the relish, finely chop the tomatoes and combine with minced onion, lime juice and salt to taste. Serve fritters hot with tomato relish on the side.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Portobello Breakfast
description: Baked portobello mushrooms filled with a savory mixture of spinach, feta, eggs, and quinoa for a protein-packed breakfast.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Remove stems from mushrooms and scrape out gills with a spoon. Brush both sides with olive oil and place on a baking sheet, cap side down.
In a large skillet, saut√© minced garlic and diced red pepper in 1 tsp olive oil for 2-3 minutes until softened. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 more minutes. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, cooked quinoa, feta, salt and pepper. Stir in the cooked spinach mixture.
Spoon the filling evenly into the mushroom caps. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is set.
Serve hot, garnished with additional feta if desired. Enjoy your nutritious breakfast!

name: Savory Sausage Spinach Frittata Muffins
description: Portable, protein-packed frittata muffins bursting with juicy sausage, wilted spinach, and melty cheese. Perfect for make-ahead breakfasts to grab on busy mornings - pop in the microwave for 30 seconds and enjoy a satisfying meal that keeps you full for hours.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray or line with silicone baking cups.
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until browned, breaking up with a spatula, about 5-7 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted, 1-2 minutes more. Let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt, pepper, onion powder and garlic powder until smooth and slightly frothy.
Stir the sausage-spinach mixture and shredded cheese into the egg mixture until well combined.
Divide egg mixture evenly between muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Bake for 20-25 minutes until puffed and golden around edges. Let cool 5 minutes before removing.

name: Crispy Tempeh Chips with Peanut Sauce
description: Crispy oven-baked tempeh chips served with a spicy peanut dipping sauce.

instructions.description: Slice the tempeh into thin strips, about 1/8 inch thick. Arrange on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1/2 tsp salt. Brush the mixture evenly over the tempeh slices.
Bake the tempeh in a preheated oven at 180¬∞C (350¬∞F) for about 25-30 minutes, flipping once halfway, until crisp and golden brown.

While the tempeh bakes, make the peanut sauce. In a food processor, blend the peanut butter, remaining 1 tbsp soy sauce, lime juice, garlic, coconut sugar, chili flakes, and 1/2 tsp salt until smooth.
Gradually add 3-4 tbsp of water to the peanut sauce while blending, until it reaches your desired dipping consistency.
Let the tempeh chips cool for 10 minutes to crisp up further. Serve with the spicy peanut dipping sauce on the side.

name: Sizzling Sesame-Ginger Chicken Lettuce Wraps
description: Juicy chicken stir-fried with Asian spices and nestled in crisp lettuce cups for a satisfying crunch. A quick and craveable meal you can enjoy hot or cold, perfect for packed lunches.

instructions.description: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Make-Ahead Tip: Chop all veggies and chicken to quickly stir-fry later.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic; stir-fry until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and nearly cooked through, about 4 minutes.
Add bell pepper and scallions. Stir-fry until veggies are crisp-tender and chicken is cooked, 2-3 minutes more.
Stir in soy sauce and vinegar, scraping up browned bits. Cook 1 minute to meld flavors. Diet Hack: The umami flavors boost satisfaction without added sugar or carbs!
Spoon the hot chicken mixture into lettuce leaves. Garnish with sesame seeds and cilantro. Serve immediately or refrigerate to enjoy cold later. Keeps well up to 4 days.

name: Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict with Dill Hollandaise
description: Elevate your breakfast game with this sophisticated twist on a classic. Perfectly poached eggs, silky smoked salmon, and a bright dill hollandaise sauce come together atop a crisp English muffin for a satisfying meal packed with heart-healthy omega-3s.

instructions.description: Fill a medium saucepan with 3 inches of water. Add vinegar and bring to a simmer over medium heat.

Crack each egg into a small ramekin or cup. Stir the vinegared water briskly to create a vortex and slide the eggs one at a time into the center. Poach for 3 minutes until the whites are set. Remove with a slotted spoon, dab with a paper towel to remove excess water, and set aside.
Melt the butter in a small saucepan until foaming subsides. In a blender, combine egg yolks, lemon juice, mustard, dill, salt, and pepper. Cover and blend for 30 seconds on medium speed.
Set the blender on high speed and slowly pour the hot butter in a thin stream through the opening in the lid. Blend for 30 more seconds until the sauce is thick and creamy.
Split and toast the English muffin. Top each half with 1 oz smoked salmon, a poached egg, and a generous drizzle of hollandaise sauce. Garnish with a sprinkle of paprika and extra dill if desired.

name: Churro-Inspired Cinnamon Yogurt Bowl
description: Indulge in the warm, cinnamon-sugar flavors of churros - in a protein-packed yogurt bowl! With just 5 minutes of prep, this satisfying snack is perfect for busy days or late-night cravings.

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix together the yogurt, protein powder, cinnamon and 1 tsp of the sweetener until smooth and well combined.
In a small dish, combine the remaining 1 tsp sweetener with a pinch more cinnamon. Sprinkle this cinnamon 'sugar' mixture over the top of the yogurt bowl.
Scatter the chocolate chips on top. Enjoy immediately for the best flavor and texture contrast between the cool yogurt and crunchy toppings.

name: Quinoa Chickpea Power Bowl
description: A nutritious and filling power bowl featuring quinoa, chickpeas, and mixed vegetables, perfect for a quick and easy lunch.

ingredients.name: mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers)

instructions.description: In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa and chickpeas.
Steam the mixed vegetables until tender-crisp, about 5-7 minutes. Add them to the bowl with the quinoa and chickpeas.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa, chickpeas, and vegetables. Toss to combine.
Serve the power bowl warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!

name: Cheesy Zucchini Rounds with Herbs
description: Savory zucchini rounds topped with melted cheese and fresh herbs make a satisfying low-carb snack. Packed with fiber and healthy fats, these tasty bites are ready in under 30 minutes.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Slice the zucchini into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Arrange the rounds in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Brush both sides of the zucchini rounds with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
In a small bowl, mix together the mozzarella, Parmesan, thyme, and basil. Sprinkle the cheese mixture evenly over the zucchini rounds.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and lightly golden.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Enjoy warm or at room temperature.

name: Maple Quinoa Breakfast Bowl
description: A hearty and healthy Canadian-inspired breakfast bowl with quinoa, fresh berries, and a touch of maple syrup.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa thoroughly under cold water. In a small saucepan, combine the quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until the water is absorbed.
While the quinoa is cooking, mix the Greek yogurt, maple syrup, and vanilla extract in a small bowl.
Once the quinoa is cooked, fluff it with a fork and let it cool for a few minutes.
In a serving bowl, layer the cooked quinoa, maple yogurt mixture, sliced strawberries, blueberries, and chopped pecans.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Power Bowl
description: A colorful medley of quinoa, roasted vegetables, creamy feta, and zesty dressing packs major flavor and nutrition into one bowl. Prep ahead for a week of lunches you'll actually look forward to eating. Equally delicious enjoyed cold or reheated.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. On a baking sheet, toss zucchini, bell pepper, onion and chickpeas with 1/2 tablespoon olive oil, salt and pepper. Roast 20-25 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, bring broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add quinoa, reduce heat, cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 1/2 tablespoon olive oil, lemon juice, garlic and oregano for the dressing.
In a serving bowl, combine cooked quinoa, roasted vegetables, tomatoes and spinach. Drizzle with dressing and toss to combine. Top with crumbled feta.

name: Hearty English Breakfast Skillet
description: A satisfying and nutritious one-pan breakfast featuring classic British ingredients with a healthy twist.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F). Cut the sausages into bite-sized pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add sausage pieces and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add sliced mushrooms and halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet. Saut√© for another 5 minutes until vegetables are softened.
Stir in the spinach and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes.
Create 5 wells in the sausage-vegetable mixture and crack an egg into each well. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes, or until egg whites are set and yolks reach desired doneness.
While the skillet is in the oven, toast the whole grain bread slices.
Remove the skillet from the oven, divide the breakfast mixture and eggs onto plates. Serve with the toasted bread on the side. Enjoy!

name: Smoked Salmon Breakfast Flatbread
description: This crispy, protein-packed flatbread is a satisfying way to start your day. Prep the components ahead for a quick, flavorful breakfast you'll look forward to.

ingredients.name: spreadable light cream cheese (or dairy-free alternative)

instructions.description: Toast the flatbread until crisp, about 2 minutes per side. Let cool slightly.
Spread the cream cheese evenly over the flatbread.
Make-Ahead Tip: Prep can be done 2 days ahead. Store components separately and assemble before serving.
Top the flatbread with flaked salmon, cucumber, red onion, and capers.
Sprinkle with everything bagel seasoning and fresh dill.
Serve with a lemon wedge. Enjoy immediately.
Diet Hack: Everything bagel seasoning adds tons of flavor without extra calories.

name: Tanzanian Coconut Chicken Stew
description: A flavorful and hearty paleo African-inspired chicken stew simmered in a creamy coconut sauce.

instructions.description: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Saut√© for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add cumin, coriander, and turmeric to the pot. Stir to combine and cook for another minute.
Add chicken thighs to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour in the chopped tomatoes and coconut milk. Bring the stew to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and let simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in the spinach and cook for an additional 5 minutes until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired. Enjoy!

name: Fiesta Taco Bowl with Cilantro-Lime Quinoa
description: Savor this zesty taco bowl packed with satisfying protein and fresh Mexican flavors. Meal-prep friendly and sure to brighten your day!

instructions.description: In a small pot, combine quinoa, water, cumin and 1/8 tsp salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer until water is absorbed, about 12-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a bowl combine beans, corn, tomatoes, lime juice and zest, remaining 1/8 tsp salt, and half the cilantro. Toss to combine.
Make-Ahead Tip: Quinoa and bean mixture can be prepared up to 3 days in advance and refrigerated.
When quinoa is done, fluff with a fork and stir in remaining cilantro. Spoon into a bowl and top with bean mixture, chicken, and avocado.
Diet Hack: Add a dollop of Greek yogurt or salsa for extra creamy satisfaction without extra calories.

name: Quinoa Protein Power Breakfast Bowl
description: A high-protein, nutrient-packed breakfast bowl featuring quinoa, tofu, and an array of colorful vegetables and herbs.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Set aside.
Press tofu to remove excess water. Crumble into small pieces.
In a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and red onion, saut√© for 2 minutes.
Add crumbled tofu, smoked paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add kale to the pan and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, tofu-kale mixture, cherry tomatoes, diced avocado, lemon juice, and fresh parsley. Toss gently to combine.
Serve the quinoa bowl warm, and enjoy your high-protein, vegetarian breakfast!

name: Herb Crusted Lamb Chops with Herbed Cauliflower Rice
description: Succulent lamb chops with a crispy herb crust, served over low-carb herbed cauliflower rice. A restaurant-quality low carb meal you can make at home.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). In a shallow bowl, mix together the almond flour, parmesan, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Dredge each lamb chop in the herb mixture, pressing to coat both sides. Shake off any excess. Place the coated chops on a baking sheet.
Bake the lamb chops in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes for medium-rare, or longer if you prefer them more well done. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
While the lamb chops are baking, melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the cauliflower rice and saut√© for 5-7 minutes until tender and starting to brown.
Remove the cauliflower rice from heat and stir in the chopped parsley. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste, if desired.
Divide the herbed cauliflower rice between plates. Top each with the baked lamb chops. Garnish with extra parsley and serve hot.

name: Tofu Dengaku with Braised Daikon and Edamame
description: Grilled miso-glazed tofu served with tender braised daikon radish and fresh edamame.

instructions.description: Drain tofu and wrap in paper towels. Place a weight on top and press for 30 minutes to remove excess moisture. Cut into 4 slices.

Peel and slice daikon into 2cm rounds. Arrange in a pot and pour in dashi stock and 1 tbsp each of mirin, sake, and soy sauce. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer covered until daikon is tender, about 20 minutes.
In a bowl, combine miso paste, 1 tbsp mirin, 1 tbsp sake, and sugar. Stir until smooth.
Preheat broiler. Brush tofu slices on both sides with oil and place on a baking sheet. Broil until lightly browned, 3-5 minutes per side. Brush generously with miso glaze and broil for 1 minute more.
Boil edamame in salted water for 3 minutes. Drain.
Serve tofu dengaku on a bed of braised daikon, garnished with edamame. Drizzle with remaining glaze.

name: Gluten-Free Italian Frittata
description: A savory and delicious Italian frittata that's perfect for a leisurely gluten-free brunch.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F). In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt.
Gradually whisk in milk and olive oil until batter is smooth. Whisk in the eggs.
Spread the tomatoes, onion and garlic in a greased 23 cm cast-iron skillet or ovenproof skillet.
Pour in the egg mixture. Sprinkle with basil and Parmesan cheese.
Bake until eggs are set and top is golden brown, about 35-40 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

name: Vegan Shepherd's Pie with Lentils and Sweet Potato Mash
description: A hearty and healthy vegan version of the classic British shepherd's pie, featuring a flavorful lentil and vegetable filling topped with creamy mashed sweet potatoes.

instructions.description: Peel and chop the sweet potatoes into large chunks. Boil in salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and mash with a fork or potato masher.
While the potatoes are cooking, rinse the lentils and cook them in a pot with 3 cups of water for 20-25 minutes or until tender. Drain any excess water.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. Saut√© until the vegetables are soft and lightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils and vegetable broth to the skillet. Simmer the mixture for 10-15 minutes until the liquid has reduced and the flavors have melded together.
Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F). Transfer the lentil mixture to a large baking dish. Spread the mashed sweet potatoes evenly over the top. Sprinkle with nutritional yeast.
Bake the shepherd's pie for 25-30 minutes until the top is lightly browned and the filling is bubbly. Let cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

name: Cheesy Spinach-Stuffed Portobello Caps
description: Savory portobello mushrooms loaded with creamy ricotta, garlicky saut√©ed spinach, and melty mozzarella. Ready in under 20 minutes using just a sheet pan, these stuffed caps make a restaurant-worthy vegetarian meal that's easy enough for busy weeknights.

ingredients.name: portobello mushroom caps, stems and gills removed

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush the portobello caps on both sides with olive oil and place them stem-side up on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes to release some of the moisture.

Meanwhile, heat the remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saut√© for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the spinach and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
In a medium bowl, mix the ricotta, half of the mozzarella, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.

Remove the mushroom caps from the oven. Carefully drain any excess liquid. Divide the ricotta mixture evenly among the caps, then top with the saut√©ed spinach. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella on top.
Return to the oven and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the mushrooms are tender, about 10 more minutes. Serve hot.

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Portobello Caps
description: Roasted portobello mushrooms packed with savory Italian sausage, feta, spinach and roasted red peppers. An easy, satisfying low-carb meal that tastes like an indulgent restaurant dish but is simple enough for busy weeknights.

ingredients.name: Italian sausage, casings removed (or ground beef)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Brush portobello caps with 1 tbsp olive oil and place on a rimmed baking sheet, gill side up. Roast for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes.
Add garlic, spinach, roasted peppers, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook, stirring, until spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes.
Remove mushroom caps from oven. Spoon sausage mixture evenly into each cap, mounding slightly. Top with crumbled feta.
Return to the oven and bake until mushrooms are tender and cheese is melted, about 8-10 minutes more. Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil if desired.

name: Caprese Quinoa Bites
description: Flavorful and healthy quinoa bites with classic caprese flavors, perfect for a satisfying pescatarian snack.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa and place it in a saucepan with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until the water is absorbed.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked quinoa, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Cut the cherry tomatoes in half and slice the mozzarella into small pieces. Chop the basil leaves finely.
Add the tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil to the quinoa mixture. Mix well.
Using your hands, form the mixture into small bite-sized balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Brush the quinoa bites with olive oil and bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve warm.

name: Matcha-Pistachio Panna Cotta with Rose Syrup
description: Luxuriously smooth and creamy matcha panna cotta, topped with a crunchy pistachio crumble and drizzled with fragrant rose syrup. This restaurant-quality dessert is surprisingly low in carbs but rich in heart-healthy fats, antioxidants, and exotic flavors.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, sprinkle the gelatin over 2 tbsp cold water. Let stand for 5 minutes to bloom.

In a small saucepan, combine the heavy cream, almond milk, 2 tbsp erythritol, and matcha powder. Whisk until smooth and heat over medium, stirring often, until steaming but not boiling, about 4-5 minutes.
Remove from heat and whisk in the bloomed gelatin and vanilla until fully dissolved, about 1 minute.
Pour the mixture into a small ramekin or serving glass. Refrigerate until set, at least 2 hours or overnight.

Meanwhile, make the pistachio crumble: Preheat oven to 325¬∞F. Toss chopped pistachios with 1/2 tsp erythritol on a small baking sheet. Bake until lightly toasted and fragrant, 6-8 minutes. Let cool completely.

For the rose syrup, combine 1 tbsp water and 1 tbsp erythritol in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave in 15-second intervals, stirring in between, until erythritol dissolves, about 1 minute total. Stir in rose water and let cool.
To serve, unmold the panna cotta onto a plate (dip bottom of ramekin in hot water for 10 seconds to loosen if needed). Sprinkle with pistachio crumble and drizzle with rose syrup. Enjoy immediately.

name: Tuna Chickpea Protein Salad
description: A quick and easy high-protein tuna salad with chickpeas, perfect for a healthy snack.

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, combine the tuna, chickpeas, celery, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the tuna mixture and stir until well combined.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Tex-Mex Breakfast Fiesta Bowl
description: A zesty, hearty breakfast bowl bursting with Southwestern flavors. Prep components ahead for a quick, satisfying morning meal that will power your day.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Combine beans, corn, bell pepper, onion, jalape√±o, tomatoes, lime juice, cilantro and spices in a bowl. Toss well, cover and refrigerate overnight.
Coat a skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium. Add eggs and scramble until just set, about 2-3 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Dice the avocado. Diet Hack: Wait until just before serving to cut the avocado so it stays green and fresh.
Assemble the bowl: Add the bean mixture to a bowl. Top with scrambled eggs and avocado. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Tuna Salad Bowl
description: A protein-packed and flavorful tuna salad with Mediterranean ingredients served over mixed greens.

instructions.description: Drain the canned tuna and flake it with a fork in a medium bowl.
Chop the cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Add them to the bowl with the tuna.
Add the kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the tuna mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Place the mixed greens in a serving bowl and top with the tuna salad. Serve immediately.

name: Mediterranean Steak & Veggie Hash
description: This hearty, flavor-packed hash will be your new brunch favorite. Tender steak, caramelized veggies, and sunny-side up eggs make a satisfying meal you'll crave again and again. Doubles easily for a shareable skillet everyone will love!

instructions.description: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steak cubes in a single layer and cook undisturbed for 2-3 minutes to develop a brown crust. Flip and cook 1 minute more for medium. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.
Add remaining 1 tbsp oil to the skillet. Add bell pepper, onion, zucchini, garlic, paprika, oregano, salt and pepper. Saut√© for 6-8 minutes until vegetables are tender and lightly caramelized.
Make 2 wells in the vegetable mixture and crack an egg into each. Cover skillet and cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat. Nestle steak cubes into the hash. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately, breaking the yolks to let them run over the hash. Enjoy!

name: Crispy Fish Tacos with Mango Slaw
description: Satisfyingly crunchy fish tacos topped with a bright, tangy mango slaw. Quick enough for busy weeknights but tasty enough to serve to guests. Pair with a side of black beans for an extra protein boost.

ingredients.name: white fish fillets (tilapia, cod, or mahi mahi)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Rub spice blend on both sides of fish fillets.
Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add seasoned fish and cook until browned and flakes easily with a fork, about 3 minutes per side.
While fish cooks, make the slaw. In a medium bowl, combine coleslaw mix, diced mango, red onion, cilantro, lime juice and Greek yogurt. Toss well.
Wrap tortillas in foil and place in preheated oven for 5 minutes to warm.
Break fish into chunks. Divide fish evenly among tortillas. Top each with mango slaw. Serve immediately.

name: Smoky Chicken Fajita Bowls
description: Juicy spice-rubbed chicken, charred peppers and onions, and creamy avocado come together in this craveable fajita bowl. Make the components ahead for easy assembly on busy weeknights - it tastes just as good reheated.

ingredients.name: canned black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook rice and beans in advance for quick assembly.
In a small bowl, mix smoked paprika, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Rub all over the chicken.

Heat 1 tsp oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook undisturbed until browned on the bottom, 5-6 min. Flip and cook until no longer pink inside, 3-4 min more. Transfer to a cutting board.
To the same skillet, add remaining 1 tsp oil, bell peppers and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until charred in spots and crisp-tender, 4-5 min. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice chicken into strips. Divide rice between bowls and top with chicken, peppers and onions, black beans, avocado and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.
Diet Hack: Load up on extra peppers and onions for volume and fiber without added calories.

name: Low-Carb Canadian Moose Roast
description: A hearty and healthy low-carb dinner featuring tender moose roast with a side of roasted vegetables.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Season the moose roast with salt, black pepper, and dried thyme.
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the moose roast on all sides until browned, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Add chopped onion and garlic to the skillet and saut√© for 2-3 minutes until softened.
Pour beef broth into the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and roast for 60-75 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the moose roast reaches 145¬∞F (63¬∞C).
While the moose roast is cooking, prepare the vegetables. Cut broccoli and carrots into bite-sized pieces.
Toss the vegetables with olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Arrange them on a baking sheet.
During the last 20-25 minutes of the moose roast cooking time, place the vegetables in the oven to roast.
Remove the moose roast and vegetables from the oven. Let the roast rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving with the roasted vegetables.

name: Sausage, Spinach & Feta Egg Muffins
description: Savory, protein-packed egg muffins with hearty sausage, fresh spinach and tangy feta cheese. Make a batch ahead for grab-and-go breakfasts that keep you full all morning. Freezer-friendly and easily customizable with your favorite mix-ins.

ingredients.name: ground pork breakfast sausage (or turkey sausage)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with oil or cooking spray.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook sausage until browned and crispy, breaking it up with a spatula, about 6-8 minutes. Drain excess fat.
Make-Ahead Tip: Cook extra sausage to have on hand for quick assembly.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt and pepper until smooth.
Evenly distribute the cooked sausage, spinach and feta among the muffin cups. Pour the egg mixture over the top, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
Bake for 18-22 minutes, until the tops are set and lightly golden. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan.
Diet Hack: Double the spinach for extra fiber and nutrients without added carbs.
Serve warm or store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Reheat in the microwave for 30-60 seconds. Freezer-friendly for up to 3 months - thaw overnight before reheating.

name: Crispy Tofu Burrito Bowl with Zesty Cilantro-Lime Rice
description: Hearty burrito bowl features crispy pan-fried tofu, zesty cilantro-lime rice, and a colorful array of veggies. Perfect for meal-prep to enjoy satisfying lunches all week. Top with creamy avocado for a restaurant-style finish.

ingredients.name: canned black beans, rinsed and drained
corn kernels (fresh, canned or thawed frozen)

instructions.description: Cut pressed tofu into 1/2-inch cubes. Toss with taco seasoning until evenly coated.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook, flipping occasionally, until crispy and browned on most sides, about 8-10 minutes.
Meanwhile, mix cooked rice with lime juice and cilantro. Season with salt to taste.
Assemble bowls: Divide rice, crispy tofu, black beans, tomatoes, corn and onion between two bowls.
Top each bowl with diced avocado. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 days (add avocado just before serving).

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad Bowls
description: Vibrant, satisfying salad bowls packed with flavorful chickpeas, crunchy veggies, and tangy lemon-herb vinaigrette. Perfect for prepping ahead for healthy lunches all week. Endlessly customizable based on what you have on hand.

ingredients.name: chickpeas, drained and rinsed (or white beans)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Combine chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, roasted peppers and olives in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate up to 3 days.
In a small jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, mustard, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Shake vigorously until emulsified, about 30 seconds.
Pour the dressing over the chickpea salad and toss gently to coat. Let marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes for the flavors to meld.
Diet Hack: For maximum crunch and volume, wait to add the salad greens until just before serving.
To serve, pile a heaping cup of greens in a bowl. Top with a generous scoop of the marinated chickpea salad. Sprinkle with feta cheese, if using.
Storage: Undressed salad keeps well up to 3 days refrigerated. Leftover dressing can be stored separately up to 5 days. Give it a good shake before using.

name: High-Protein Tuna Avocado Snack Wrap
description: A quick and easy high-protein snack wrap with tuna, avocado, spinach and whole wheat tortilla.

ingredients.name: Canned tuna packed in water, drained

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the drained tuna with mashed avocado and lemon juice until well combined.
Place the whole wheat tortilla on a flat surface. Spread the tuna-avocado mixture evenly over the tortilla, leaving a small border around the edges.
Top the tuna-avocado mixture with baby spinach.
Carefully roll up the tortilla tightly, tucking in the edges as you go. Cut the wrap in half diagonally.

name: Savory Spiced Tofu Scramble Tacos
description: Flavorful scrambled tofu seasoned with nutritional yeast, chili powder, and smoked paprika, served in warm soft corn tortillas with black beans and spinach for a protein-packed vegan breakfast taco.

instructions.description: In a bowl, crumble the tofu into small pieces. Add nutritional yeast, chili powder, smoked paprika, turmeric, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Mix well to evenly season the tofu.
Warm a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the seasoned tofu and cook, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes until heated through and slightly browned.
Meanwhile, wrap the corn tortillas in damp paper towels and microwave for 30 seconds until warmed and softened.
Divide the tofu scramble between the tortillas. Top each with black beans and spinach. Fold the tortillas in half and serve immediately.

name: Brazillian Cheese and Fish Croquettes
description: Crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, these cheese and fish croquettes make a satisfying pescatarian snack inspired by the flavors of Brazil.

instructions.description: Soak the dried cod in cold water for 24 hours, changing the water at least once.
Drain the cod and poach it gently in a pot of simmering water for 10 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly, then flake into pieces.
Meanwhile, boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash them.
In a large bowl, mix the flaked cod, mashed potato, parmesan, egg, chopped parsley, salt and pepper into a thick batter.
Form the batter into small oblong croquettes. Dredge each one in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
In a deep skillet, heat the vegetable oil to 350¬∞F. Fry the breaded croquettes in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Serve the croquettes hot as a snack or appetizer. Optionally serve with hot sauce or garlic aioli for dipping.

name: Spiced Lentil Tacos with Avocado Crema
description: Satisfying lentil tacos bursting with Mexican spices, topped with a cool avocado crema. Ready in under 30 minutes using pantry staples. Perfect for Taco Tuesday - meat eaters won't miss a thing!

instructions.description: In a medium pot, combine the lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain excess liquid.

Meanwhile, heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saut√© until translucent, 5 minutes. Add the garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika and salt. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute.
Add the cooked lentils to the skillet and stir to combine with the spices. Mash lightly with a potato masher or fork for a refried bean texture. Keep warm.
Make the avocado crema: Mash the avocado in a bowl. Stir in the yogurt and lime juice until smooth. Season with salt to taste.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or microwave. Fill each with the lentil mixture, lettuce, tomatoes and a dollop of avocado crema. Serve immediately.

name: Tofu Scramble Breakfast Bowl
description: A protein-packed vegetarian breakfast bowl featuring scrambled tofu, quinoa, and saut√©ed vegetables.

ingredients.name: mixed vegetables (e.g., spinach, bell peppers, mushrooms)

instructions.description: Drain the tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Crumble the tofu into small pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the crumbled tofu and the vegetable broth. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the nutritional yeast, turmeric, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the tofu. Stir well to combine and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
In a separate pan, saut√© the mixed vegetables until tender, about 5 minutes.
In a serving bowl, layer the cooked quinoa, scrambled tofu, and saut√©ed vegetables. Serve hot.

name: Chinese Low Carb Egg Custard Tarts
description: Creamy egg custard baked in a flaky almond flour crust for a low carb version of the classic Chinese dessert.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (180¬∞C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with coconut oil.

In a bowl, mix the almond flour, 3 tbsp erythritol, and salt. Stir in 4 tbsp melted coconut oil until a crumbly dough forms. Press the dough evenly into the muffin cups and up the sides to form the crusts.
Bake the crusts for 8-10 minutes until lightly golden. Remove from the oven but keep the oven on.
In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, remaining 3 tbsp erythritol, and vanilla extract until smooth. Carefully pour the custard into the crusts.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until the custard is set but still slightly jiggly in the centers. Let cool completely in the pan before removing.

name: Spicy Beef Zucchini Boats
description: A high-protein paleo dinner featuring seasoned ground beef stuffed into zucchini boats.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Cut the zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the center pulp, leaving 1/2-inch thick walls on the sides. Set aside.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef, onion, and garlic. Cook for 6-8 minutes until the beef is browned, breaking it apart as it cooks.
Drain excess fat from the beef. Stir in the diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until heated through.
Spoon the beef mixture evenly into the zucchini halves. Place them in a baking dish and bake for 10-12 minutes until the zucchini is tender.

name: Cheesy Sausage Frittata
description: A hearty and flavorful baked egg dish packed with savory sausage and melted cheese.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Grease a 9-inch pie plate with olive oil.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage until browned and crumbled, about 5-7 minutes. Drain excess fat.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Stir in the cooked sausage, shredded cheese, and baby spinach.
Pour the mixture into the prepared pie plate.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Spiced Shrimp Nasi Goreng Scramble
description: A fragrant, flavorful twist on a classic Indonesian fried rice, made low-carb friendly with fluffy eggs and crisp-tender vegetables. Loaded with garlic, ginger and aromatic spices for a satisfying, protein-packed breakfast that will energize your day.

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs with 1 tbsp water and a pinch of salt until frothy and well-combined. Set aside.
Heat the coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, shallot and ginger. Saut√© until fragrant and softened, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the shrimp to the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes. Transfer shrimp to a plate.
Add the bell pepper and bok choy to the skillet. Saut√© until crisp-tender, about 3-4 minutes. Season with fish sauce and sambal oelek.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet. Pour the beaten eggs into the empty space. Let set slightly, then scramble gently until eggs are cooked but still soft, about 2-3 minutes.
Return the shrimp to the skillet. Gently fold everything together until combined and heated through, 1-2 minutes more. Remove from heat.
Squeeze lime juice over the shrimp scramble. Garnish generously with fresh cilantro. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Cinnamon-Walnut Baklava Cups
description: Honey-free baklava in phyllo cups, with cinnamon-spiced walnuts and a citrus syrup. A guilt-free, portion-controlled twist on the classic Greek dessert, packed with heart-healthy omega-3s.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Place phyllo cups on a baking sheet and toast until lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Set aside.
In a food processor, pulse the walnuts until finely chopped. Transfer to a bowl and mix with cinnamon and cardamom until evenly coated.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the date syrup, orange juice, lemon zest and vanilla. Simmer over medium heat until syrupy and reduced by half, about 3-4 minutes.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the walnut mixture into each phyllo cup. Drizzle each cup with about 1 teaspoon of the syrup.
Return to the oven and bake until the filling is hot and the phyllo is crisp and browned, about 8-10 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Mascarpone Pudding with Fresh Berries
description: A light and creamy gluten-free Italian dessert with mascarpone cheese and fresh mixed berries.

instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract. Whisk until smooth and well combined.
Transfer the mixture to a serving glass or bowl.
Top the mascarpone pudding with fresh mixed berries.
Chill the dessert in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes before serving.
