name: Ginger Pork Stir-Fry with Cauliflower Rice
description: A spicy and savory pork stir-fry served over low-carb cauliflower rice, perfect for a filling keto lunch.

instructions.description: Cut the pork loin into thin strips. Mince the garlic and ginger. Slice the bell pepper and green onions.
In a bowl, mix the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, chili paste, and salt to make the stir-fry sauce.
Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the pork and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until browned.
Add the garlic, ginger, bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Pour in the stir-fry sauce and cook for 1-2 minutes until the pork is coated and cooked through.
Stir in the green onions. Serve hot over steamed cauliflower rice.

name: West African Chicken and Peanut Stew
description: A flavorful and protein-packed chicken stew with a creamy peanut butter sauce, inspired by West African cuisine.

instructions.description: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Dice the onion and mince the garlic.
In a large pot, saut√© the onion and garlic in a little oil until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the chicken, tomato paste, peanut butter, broth, cayenne, salt and pepper. Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce has thickened.
Serve the stew over cooked quinoa and garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Sizzling Tofu Satay Noodle Bowl
description: Savory marinated tofu skewers nestle into a colorful veggie-packed noodle bowl bursting with bright Asian flavors. Meal-prep the components ahead for satisfying desk lunches that will be the envy of the office.

instructions.description: In a shallow dish, whisk together the soy sauce, lime juice, sesame oil, garlic and ginger. Add the tofu cubes and gently toss to coat. Marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to 24 hours covered in the fridge.

If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 10 minutes. Thread the marinated tofu onto the skewers. Make-Ahead Tip: The tofu skewers can be prepared up to a day ahead and stored in an airtight container.
Cook the brown rice noodles according to package directions until al dente. Rinse under cold water, drain well, and set aside.
Diet Hack: Use the tofu marinade to quickly pickle the sliced veggies. In a bowl, toss the bell pepper, carrot, and cucumber with the remaining marinade. Let stand for 5 minutes to lightly pickle.
Heat a grill pan or non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the tofu skewers for 2-3 minutes per side until lightly charred and heated through.

To serve, place the cooked noodles in a bowl. Top with the grilled tofu skewers and pickled vegetables. Garnish generously with cilantro and chopped peanuts for added crunch and flavor. Serve any remaining marinade on the side for drizzling.

name: Steamed Egg & Shrimp Custard
description: A protein-packed Chinese-style savory custard with eggs, shrimp, and vegetables, perfect for a pescatarian breakfast.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, vegetable stock, salt, and white pepper until smooth.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger; saut√© for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and opaque. Remove from heat and set aside.
Grease 6 ramekins or a large heat-proof dish. Divide the bok choy evenly among the ramekins.
Pour the egg mixture over the bok choy, then top with the cooked shrimp.
Prepare a steamer by bringing water to a boil. Place the ramekins in the steamer, cover, and steam for 12-15 minutes until the custard is set.
Carefully remove the ramekins from the steamer and serve hot.

name: Spicy Tofu Satay Skewers
description: Flavorful baked tofu skewers marinated in an Indonesian-inspired spicy satay sauce.

instructions.description: Press tofu for 20 minutes to remove excess water. Cut into 1-inch cubes.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic and ginger, brown sugar, chili paste, and oil.
Add tofu and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 450¬∞F (230¬∞C). Thread tofu onto soaked skewers alternating with green onion pieces.
Place skewers on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, turning halfway through.
Serve hot with extra marinade for dipping, if desired.

name: Scandinavian Salmon and Root Vegetable Bake
description: A hearty and healthy dairy-free Scandinavian-inspired baked salmon dish with assorted root vegetables.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F). Grease a large baking dish with olive oil.
Peel and cut potatoes, carrots, and parsnips into bite-sized pieces. Slice the red onion into wedges. Mince the garlic cloves.
In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Add the prepared vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
Spread the vegetable mixture in the prepared baking dish. Place the salmon fillets on top of the vegetables.
Bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Remove from the oven and garnish with fresh dill. Serve hot.

name: Zesty Mexican Quinoa Fiesta Bowl
description: A satisfying medley of fluffy quinoa, hearty black beans, and colorful veggies in a tangy lime dressing. Meal prep a big batch on Sunday and enjoy quick, flavorful lunches all week. Top with creamy avocado for an extra filling boost!

ingredients.name: canned black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh strainer. In a small saucepan, combine the quinoa and broth. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, black beans, tomatoes, bell pepper, onion, jalapeno (if using), and cilantro. Toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, cumin, garlic powder, and salt. Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and stir to coat evenly.
Divide the quinoa salad between bowls. Top each with diced avocado. Serve immediately or refrigerate in airtight containers for up to 4 days. Tastes great chilled or at room temperature.

name: Mediterranean Chicken and Quinoa Bowls
description: Juicy lemon-herb chicken, fluffy quinoa, and colorful roasted vegetables combine in this satisfying meal-prep friendly lunch. Enjoy hot or cold for a filling, nutritious midday boost that will power you through the afternoon.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Make marinade: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, oregano, salt and pepper.
Place chicken in a shallow dish and pour 2/3 of the marinade over it, reserving the rest. Let marinate while you prepare the vegetables.
Make-Ahead Tip: Marinate chicken up to 8 hours for extra flavor.
On the lined baking sheet, toss zucchini, bell pepper and onion with reserved marinade. Spread in a single layer, then nestle marinated chicken amongst the vegetables.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until chicken is cooked through (165¬∞F internal temperature) and vegetables are tender and lightly caramelized.
Meanwhile, cook quinoa according to package directions. Fluff with a fork.
Diet Hack: Toast quinoa in the pot before adding water for nutty depth of flavor without extra oil.
When chicken and vegetables are done, let cool slightly then slice chicken into strips.
Assemble bowl: Fill a container with quinoa, then top with chicken, roasted vegetables, tomatoes and feta. Keeps up to 4 days refrigerated.
Serving suggestion: Drizzle with additional lemon juice or your favorite light vinaigrette for extra zing.

name: Spiced Chickpea Shakshuka
description: A flavorful and hearty vegetarian breakfast dish with African spices, chickpeas, and baked eggs in a rich tomato sauce.

instructions.description: Heat olive oil in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in chickpeas, crushed tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add kale and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Create 6 wells in the chickpea mixture and carefully crack an egg into each well.
Transfer the skillet to a preheated 375¬∞F (190¬∞C) oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and yolks are still runny.
Remove from the oven, sprinkle with chopped cilantro, and serve hot with crusty bread or pita.

name: Pistachio-Crusted Chicken with Feta Spinach Saut√©
description: Juicy chicken breasts with a crunchy pistachio crust, served over a bed of garlicky saut√©ed spinach dotted with briny feta. Ready in 30 minutes and perfect for meal prep - the leftovers taste great cold over salad greens.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper.
Brush both sides of the chicken with Dijon mustard. Press chopped pistachios onto the mustard to form a crust. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake chicken for 20-25 minutes, until a meat thermometer reads 165¬∞F when inserted into the thickest part. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing.
While the chicken bakes, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saut√© until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add spinach to the skillet and saut√© until just wilted, 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and stir in feta.
Divide the spinach between two plates. Top each with a sliced pistachio-crusted chicken breast. Drizzle with remaining olive oil and serve.

name: Creamy Chocolate Avocado Pudding
description: A rich and indulgent chocolate pudding made with healthy avocado for a keto-friendly, high-protein treat.

instructions.description: Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a food processor or blender.
Add the cocoa powder, protein powder, sweetener, almond milk, vanilla, and salt to the food processor.
Blend all ingredients until completely smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed.
Taste and adjust sweetness if desired by adding a bit more sweetener.
Transfer the pudding to a bowl and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

name: Creamy Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta with Fresh Berries
description: Silky smooth panna cotta infused with aromatic vanilla bean and topped with juicy fresh berries. Satisfies your sweet tooth with a protein boost, while being an easy make-ahead dessert that looks elegant enough for entertaining.

ingredients.name: vanilla bean, scraped (or 1 tsp vanilla extract)

instructions.description: In a small bowl, sprinkle the gelatin over the water. Let stand for 5 minutes to soften.
In a saucepan, whisk together the cream, almond milk, protein powder, vanilla bean seeds, and stevia over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until hot but not boiling.
Remove from heat and whisk in the softened gelatin until fully dissolved, about 1 minute.
Pour into 2 small ramekins or dessert glasses. Refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours, or overnight for best results.
When ready to serve, top with fresh berries. Enjoy the creamy, indulgent texture and natural sweetness - it tastes like cheating but fits your low-carb goals!

name: Keto South American Brunch Scramble
description: A high-protein, low-carb brunch dish with bold South American flavors and a spicy kick.

instructions.description: Dice the chorizo, bell pepper, poblano pepper, and onion.
In a large skillet, brown the chorizo over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, saut√© the diced peppers and onion until softened, about 6 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with salt, black pepper, and chipotle powder until well blended.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until eggs are scrambled and just set, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked chorizo, then crumble the queso fresco on top.
Garnish with chopped cilantro, sliced avocado, and a squeeze of lime juice. Serve hot.

name: Skyr Salmon Souffle
description: A fluffy high-protein salmon souffle made with Icelandic skyr cheese, perfect for a filling keto breakfast.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C. Grease a large ramekin with butter.
Separate the egg whites from the yolks into two bowls. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
In another bowl, mix the skyr, egg yolks, heavy cream, chopped dill, lemon juice, almond flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
Dice the smoked salmon into small pieces and gently fold into the skyr mixture.
Carefully fold the beaten egg whites into the salmon mixture, trying not to overmix and lose too much air.
Pour the mixture into the prepared ramekin. Bake for 35-40 minutes until puffed and lightly browned on top.
Serve the souffle immediately, garnished with extra dill if desired.

name: Keto Smoked Salmon Egg Bake
description: A rich and satisfying keto breakfast casserole loaded with smoked salmon, eggs, and Scandinavian flavors.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Grease a small baking dish with butter.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, dill, chives, salt, and pepper until well combined.
In another bowl, mix the almond flour and baking powder.
Add the almond flour mixture to the egg mixture and whisk until smooth.
Fold in the chopped smoked salmon.
Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown and set in the center.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Keto Vietnamese Breakfast Bowl
description: A delicious and healthy keto-friendly Vietnamese breakfast bowl with lemongrass pork, soft-boiled egg, and low-carb vegetables.

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the ground pork, lemongrass, garlic, fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Let marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat the coconut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the marinated pork and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through.

While the pork is cooking, bring a small pot of water to a boil. Gently lower the egg into the water and cook for 6 minutes for a soft-boiled egg. Remove the egg and place it in an ice bath for 1 minute before peeling.
In a serving bowl, arrange the cooked pork, bean sprouts, sliced cucumber, and soft-boiled egg. Drizzle with lime juice and serve immediately.

name: Mediterranean Tuna & White Bean Power Wrap
description: Bursting with briny Mediterranean flavors, this hearty yet healthy wrap features protein-packed tuna and creamy cannellini beans. Crunchy cucumber, juicy tomatoes, and tangy feta come together in a whole wheat wrap for a satisfying midday meal that will power you through the afternoon.

ingredients.name: canned cannellini beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.description: In a medium bowl, combine the tuna, cannellini beans, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, feta, and olives. Gently toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the tuna mixture and stir until everything is evenly coated. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Warm the tortilla in the microwave for 15-20 seconds until pliable. Lay it out on a flat surface.
Spoon the tuna and bean mixture down the center of the tortilla, leaving about an inch of space on each end.
Fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then tightly roll from the bottom up to form a compact wrap.
Slice the wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately, or wrap tightly in foil to pack for lunch. Enjoy!

name: Nasi Goreng Cauliflower Rice Breakfast Bowl
description: Fragrant cauliflower rice stir-fried with aromatic spices, crispy tofu, and a sunny-side up egg. This low-carb twist on a classic Indonesian breakfast packs big flavors while keeping you energized all morning.

ingredients.name: red chili pepper, seeded and finely chopped

instructions.description: Press the tofu block between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes and set aside.

Heat 1/2 tbsp coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes and cook undisturbed until crisp and browned on the bottom, about 3-4 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, 2-3 minutes more. Transfer to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium and add remaining 1/2 tbsp coconut oil to the skillet. Add shallots, garlic, and red chili pepper. Cook until fragrant and slightly softened, 2-3 minutes.

Add cauliflower rice, soy sauce, cumin and coriander. Stir-fry until cauliflower is tender-crisp and spices are toasted, 4-5 minutes. Add tofu back to the pan and toss to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl.
Wipe out the skillet and return to medium heat. Crack the egg into the pan and cook until whites are set but yolk is still runny, about 3 minutes. Place the fried egg on top of the cauliflower rice.
Garnish with green onions and a squeeze of fresh lime juice. Serve immediately.

name: Keto Indonesian Coconut Pancakes
description: Fluffy coconut pancakes topped with a spicy peanut sauce, perfect for a keto-friendly Indonesian-inspired brunch.

instructions.description: In a bowl, whisk together the coconut flour, eggs, coconut milk, erythritol, baking powder, and salt until smooth.
Heat a greased skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown. Set aside.
In a small bowl, mix the peanut butter, coconut aminos, sriracha, and lime juice until combined into a smooth sauce.
Serve the pancakes warm, drizzled with the spicy peanut sauce. Enjoy!

name: Mediterranean Chickpea & Tuna Power Salad
description: This refreshing and zesty salad packs a protein punch from hearty chickpeas and flaky tuna, balanced with crisp veggies and a bright lemon-herb vinaigrette. Loaded with fiber, healthy fats, and anti-inflammatory ingredients, it will keep you energized and satisfied.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, tuna, cucumber, tomatoes, bell pepper, red onion, olives and parsley. Gently toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon, garlic, salt and pepper until emulsified, about 30 seconds.
Pour the dressing over the chickpea mixture and stir well to coat evenly. Taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed.
Serve chilled or at room temperature. Salad can be made ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

name: Spicy Tuna Quinoa Bowl
description: A protein-packed, flavorful tuna and quinoa bowl with a kick of spice, perfect for a quick and healthy lunch.

instructions.description: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside to cool.
In a bowl, mix the drained tuna, diced avocado, halved cherry tomatoes, finely chopped red onion, and minced jalapeno pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Add the cooled quinoa to the tuna mixture and pour the dressing over it. Mix well to combine.
Serve the spicy tuna quinoa bowl immediately and enjoy!

name: Spicy Peanut Chicken Lettuce Wraps
description: Tender chicken tossed with crunchy vegetables and a flavorful peanut sauce, tucked into crisp lettuce leaves. Perfect for a satisfying lunch on-the-go or a light dinner. Keeps well in the fridge for easy meal prep.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sriracha, and garlic until smooth. Set aside.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Add the peanut sauce to the chicken and toss to coat well.
To assemble wraps, lay out lettuce leaves. Fill each with chicken, then top with bell pepper, carrot, and cucumber. Wrap the lettuce around the filling and enjoy immediately.
Serve any extra sauce on the side for dipping. Refrigerate leftover components separately for up to 3 days.

name: Tuna Avocado Protein Wrap
description: A protein-packed wrap with tuna, avocado, and spinach, perfect for a healthy snack.

instructions.description: In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork. Add lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Add the drained tuna to the avocado mixture and mix until combined.
Place the tortilla wrap on a flat surface. Spread the tuna-avocado mixture evenly on the wrap, leaving a small border around the edges.
Add a layer of baby spinach leaves on top of the tuna-avocado mixture.
Roll the wrap tightly, tucking in the sides as you go. Cut the wrap in half diagonally and serve.

name: Keto Asian Pork Cabbage Rolls
description: Savory pork filling wrapped in tender cabbage leaves, simmered in a flavorful Asian-inspired broth.

instructions.description: Blanch the cabbage leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then remove and set aside to cool.
In a bowl, mix the ground pork, mushrooms, green onions, ginger, garlic, 1 tbsp tamari, rice vinegar, sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
Place about 1/4 cup of the pork mixture in the center of each cabbage leaf. Fold the sides and roll up tightly.
Arrange the rolls seam-side down in a steamer basket. Steam for 20 minutes.
In a saucepan, bring the chicken broth and remaining 1 tbsp tamari to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Transfer the steamed rolls to serving bowls and pour the broth over them. Serve hot.

name: Brazilian Breakfast Frittata
description: A protein-packed paleo frittata with bold Brazilian flavors, perfect to start your day.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, black pepper, and cumin until well combined.
Heat the avocado oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, red bell pepper, and garlic. Saut√© for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the diced chicken to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet, making sure it evenly covers the chicken and vegetables. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the frittata is set and lightly golden on top.
Remove the frittata from the oven and let it cool for 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro, slice, and serve hot.

name: Lox Breakfast Pizza with Herbed Ricotta and Capers
description: Savor this indulgent yet wholesome breakfast pizza featuring smoked salmon, creamy herbed ricotta, and zesty capers. The crisp homemade crust, vibrant greens, and refreshing dill create a symphony of flavors and textures to energize your morning.

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the yeast and warm water. Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add 1 cup flour, salt and 1 tbsp olive oil to the yeast. Mix until a sticky dough forms.
On a floured surface, knead the dough, adding more flour as needed, until smooth and elastic, 8-10 minutes.
Brush a bowl with oil, add the dough, cover and let rise in a warm spot until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough and stretch into a 10-inch circle on a baking sheet. Brush with remaining oil. Let rest 10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 450¬∞F. Mix ricotta, lemon zest, dill and pepper.
Spread the ricotta over dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Bake until crust is golden, 12-15 minutes.
Top the pizza with salmon, arugula, capers and onion. Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

name: Spicy Huevos Rancheros
description: A flavorful and protein-packed Mexican breakfast featuring corn tortillas topped with black beans, salsa, and fried eggs.

instructions.description: In a small skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Fry the eggs sunny-side up or over-easy, about 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat the black beans in a small saucepan or in the microwave until warm, about 2 minutes.
Warm the corn tortillas in a skillet or wrapped in a damp paper towel in the microwave for 30 seconds.
To assemble, place the tortillas on a plate. Top with the black beans, salsa, and fried eggs.
Slice the avocado and add it to the plate. Squeeze lime juice over everything. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Indonesian Sweet Potato Cakes
description: These delightful sweet potato cakes are a healthy and tasty snack inspired by Indonesian cuisine.

instructions.description: Peel and cut the sweet potatoes into small cubes. Steam until tender, about 15 minutes.
Mash the steamed sweet potatoes in a large bowl.
Add coconut milk, rice flour, shredded coconut, palm sugar, salt, and vanilla extract to the mashed sweet potatoes. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into small cakes, about 2 inches in diameter.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Cook the cakes for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Serve warm and enjoy your healthy Indonesian sweet potato cakes!

name: Tuna Avocado Power Wrap
description: A protein-packed snack wrap with tuna, avocado, spinach and whole wheat tortilla.

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the drained tuna with mashed avocado, lemon juice, salt and pepper until well combined.
Lay out the whole wheat tortilla and place the baby spinach leaves in the center.
Spoon the tuna avocado mixture onto the spinach leaves.
Fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll it up tightly to form a wrap. Cut in half and enjoy!

name: Greek Yogurt Baklava Cups
description: A lighter, healthier twist on traditional baklava featuring crispy phyllo cups filled with a sweet honey-walnut filling and topped with creamy Greek yogurt.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Place phyllo cups on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes until crisp and lightly browned. Let cool.
In a food processor, pulse the walnuts until finely chopped. Transfer to a bowl and mix with honey and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, mix together the Greek yogurt and vanilla extract until smooth.
Spoon the honey walnut mixture evenly into the cooled phyllo cups.
Top each cup with a dollop of the vanilla yogurt mixture. Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.

name: Savory Tofu Scramble Breakfast Bowls
description: Protein-packed scrambled tofu bowls with roasted veggies, perfect for a filling dairy-free breakfast.

instructions.description: Press tofu for 30 minutes to remove excess water. Crumble into bite-sized pieces.
Preheat oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Toss peppers and onions with 1 tbsp olive oil on a baking sheet. Roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
Heat remaining 2 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add crumbled tofu and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic, turmeric, smoked paprika, salt and pepper to the tofu. Stir to combine and cook 2 more minutes.
Add kale to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes. Stir roasted veggies into the scrambled tofu.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Divide tofu scramble into 5 bowls and serve hot. Enjoy!

name: Seared Salmon with Roasted Butternut Squash
description: A healthy and satisfying low-carb dinner featuring tender salmon and caramelized butternut squash.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
Peel and cut the butternut squash into 1-inch cubes. Toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet.
Roast the squash in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, until tender and caramelized. Flip halfway through.
Meanwhile, season the salmon with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, until golden and cooked through. Squeeze lemon juice over the salmon.
Serve the salmon alongside the roasted butternut squash.

name: Tofu Scramble Power Bowl
description: A hearty vegan breakfast bowl packed with protein-rich tofu scramble, beans, and veggies.

instructions.description: Drain and press tofu for 10 minutes to remove excess liquid. Crumble into bite-sized pieces.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Saut√© onions until translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add crumbled tofu, turmeric, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in black beans and spinach. Cook until spinach is wilted and beans are heated through, about 2-3 minutes.
Transfer tofu scramble to a bowl. Top with cherry tomatoes. Serve immediately.

name: Savory Mushroom and Spinach Strata
description: A hearty, protein-packed strata with mushrooms, spinach, and dairy-free cheese, perfect for a weekend brunch.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Cut bread into 1-inch cubes and arrange in the prepared baking dish.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, almond milk, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the bread cubes, then top with the mushroom-spinach mixture and shredded dairy-free cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the center is set. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Gluten-Free Italian Breakfast Scramble
description: A savory and satisfying gluten-free breakfast scramble with Italian flavors.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F). Cut the gluten-free bread into 1-inch cubes and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly toasted. Set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper. Set aside.

Remove the casing from the Italian sausage. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook, breaking it into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes.
Add the diced red bell pepper, onion, and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are set but still moist, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the toasted bread cubes and fresh basil. Grate Parmesan cheese over the top and serve immediately.

name: French-Style Smoked Salmon Breakfast Tart
description: A delightful French-inspired breakfast tart featuring smoked salmon, eggs, and herbs in a crispy pastry shell.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Roll out the puff pastry and place it in a 6-inch tart pan, pressing it into the bottom and sides. Prick the bottom with a fork.
Bake the pastry shell for 10 minutes, or until lightly golden. Remove from the oven and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, dill, capers, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Scatter the chopped smoked salmon evenly over the bottom of the pre-baked pastry shell.
Pour the egg mixture over the salmon, ensuring it's evenly distributed.
Return the tart to the oven and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set and lightly golden on top.
Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving. Garnish with additional fresh dill, if desired.

name: Herby Chicken Pita Pockets with Cucumber-Feta Salad
description: Juicy grilled chicken stuffed into warm pita with fresh veggies and tangy feta. Marinated in bright Mediterranean flavors and ready in minutes, this portable lunch will keep you fueled and satisfied.

instructions.description: In a shallow bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, garlic powder, 1/8 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper. Add chicken and turn to coat. Let marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, chop romaine, tomato, onion and cucumber. Toss vegetables with feta, dill, lemon juice, and remaining 1/8 tsp each salt and pepper.

Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before slicing.
Warm the pita bread in the microwave for 15-20 seconds until soft and pliable. Cut in half to form pockets.
Stuff each pita half with sliced chicken and cucumber-feta salad. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Mango Coconut Sticky Rice Pudding
description: A sweet and creamy vegan Chinese dessert made with coconut milk, sticky rice, and fresh mango.

instructions.description: Rinse the glutinous rice several times until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Drain the rice and steam it in a steamer basket for 20-25 minutes until translucent and tender.
While the rice is steaming, combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
When the rice is done, transfer it to a large bowl. Pour the hot coconut milk mixture over the rice and mix well. Let it sit for 10-15 minutes until the rice absorbs the liquid.
Peel and slice the mangoes. Serve the sticky rice pudding with mango slices on top and sprinkle with shredded coconut.

name: Saffron-Spiced Chickpea and Vegetable Wraps
description: Fragrant chickpeas, roasted veggies and creamy tahini sauce wrapped in soft flatbread for a satisfying portable lunch. Make a batch ahead for grab-and-go meals all week that you'll actually look forward to.

ingredients.name: whole wheat tortillas or pita bread

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, toss chickpeas, zucchini, bell pepper and onion with oil, cumin, paprika, saffron and salt.
Spread on baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until veggies are tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, make tahini sauce: Whisk together tahini, lemon juice, garlic and water until smooth.
Warm tortillas/pita. Spread each with tahini sauce. Top with spinach/arugula and roasted chickpea-veggie mixture.
Wrap tightly, tucking in ends. Cut in half and enjoy warm or cold. Store extra wraps refrigerated up to 4 days.

name: Matcha Protein Pudding Cups
description: Creamy matcha pudding cups packed with protein and topped with sugar-free whipped cream. A satisfying keto-friendly Japanese-inspired dessert.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, mix the gelatin with boiling water until fully dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly.
In a medium saucepan, whisk together 3/4 cup heavy cream, almond milk, matcha powder, protein powder, and erythritol over medium heat.
Heat the mixture, whisking continuously, until it just starts to simmer. Remove from heat and whisk in the gelatin mixture until fully incorporated.
Pour the pudding mixture into 4 small ramekins or cups. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until set.
When ready to serve, whip the remaining 1/4 cup heavy cream with a dash of erythritol until stiff peaks form. Top each pudding cup with a dollop of whipped cream. Enjoy chilled!

name: Italian Caprese Bites
description: Juicy cherry tomatoes pair with creamy fresh mozzarella and bright basil pesto in these addictive, poppable bites. Perfect for snacking or an impressive party appetizer that comes together in minutes.

instructions.description: Thread one cherry tomato and one mozzarella ball onto a small skewer or toothpick. Repeat with remaining tomatoes and mozzarella to make 10 skewers.
Arrange the skewers on a serving plate. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Drop small spoonfuls of pesto over the skewers (about 1/2 teaspoon each). Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts.
Serve immediately at room temperature. Enjoy within 2 hours for best quality.

name: Thai Basil Chicken Stir-Fry
description: A healthy and protein-packed Thai-inspired stir-fry with chicken, vegetables, and aromatic basil.

instructions.description: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Slice the bell pepper and zucchini. Mince the garlic and shallot.
In a small bowl, mix together the fish sauce, coconut aminos, and lime juice. Set aside.
Heat the coconut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and shallot, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through.
Add the sliced bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet. Stir-fry for an additional 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables. Stir well to coat evenly. Cook for 1-2 minutes more until the sauce is heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in the Thai basil leaves. Serve hot.

name: Zesty Breakfast Scramble with Roasted Potatoes
description: This flavorful scramble packs a protein punch while keeping you full and satisfied all morning. Prep the potatoes ahead for a speedy, stress-free breakfast that's anything but boring.

ingredients.name: firm tofu, drained and crumbled (or scrambled eggs for non-vegan)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Toss diced potatoes with 1/2 tsp olive oil, 1/4 tsp salt, and 1/8 tsp pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until crispy. Make-Ahead Tip: Potatoes can be roasted up to 3 days ahead and reheated.
Meanwhile, heat remaining 1/2 tsp oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper; saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic powder, cumin, smoked paprika, 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper to the skillet. Cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Crumble tofu into the skillet (or add whisked eggs for non-vegan). Cook, stirring often, until set, 3-4 minutes. Stir in spinach and cook until just wilted, 1 minute more.
Serve scramble with roasted potatoes on the side. Diet Hack: Add your favorite salsa or hot sauce for an extra flavor boost without added calories.

name: Spiced Plantain Chips
description: A healthy and flavorful snack made with plantains and African-inspired spices.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
Peel the plantains and slice them thinly using a mandoline or sharp knife.
In a large bowl, toss the plantain slices with olive oil, berbere spice blend, and salt until evenly coated.
Arrange the plantain slices in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the plantain chips are crispy and golden brown. Flip them halfway through baking for even cooking.
Remove from the oven and let the chips cool completely before serving.

name: Thai Basil Chicken Stir-Fry with Cashews
description: Bursting with bold Thai flavors, this satisfying chicken stir-fry features tender chicken, crunchy cashews, and aromatic basil. Served over fluffy rice, it's a protein-packed, gluten-free meal that comes together in just 30 minutes.

ingredients.name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooked jasmine rice (use brown rice for more fiber)

instructions.description: Heat the coconut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat until shimmering, about 1 minute.
Add the chicken pieces in a single layer and cook, undisturbed, until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, 2 minutes more.
Add the bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Stir-fry until the vegetables are crisp-tender and the chicken is cooked through, 3-4 minutes.
Push the chicken and vegetables to the side of the skillet. Add the curry paste to the center and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour in the tamari, fish sauce, and coconut sugar. Stir everything together until well combined and simmering. Cook for 1 minute to allow the flavors to meld.
Add the cashews and basil leaves. Toss to combine and cook just until the basil is wilted, about 30 seconds.
Serve the stir-fry hot over jasmine rice, with lime wedges on the side for squeezing.

name: Matcha-Pistachio Cheesecake Pots with Sesame Crust
description: Lusciously creamy matcha cheesecake layered over a toasted sesame crust, topped with vibrant pistachios. High in healthy fats and fiber, this portion-controlled treat will satisfy your sweet tooth without the sugar rush.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Spread sesame seeds on a baking sheet and toast for 5-7 minutes until fragrant and lightly golden. Let cool.

In a food processor, pulse the cooled sesame seeds until coarsely ground. Add almond flour and melted butter and pulse until the mixture resembles wet sand. Divide between two 4-oz ramekins and press firmly into an even crust. Refrigerate while preparing the filling.

In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the heavy cream, matcha powder, erythritol, and vanilla. Beat on low speed until incorporated, then increase to high and beat until light and fluffy, 1-2 minutes more.
Spoon the matcha cheesecake mixture into the prepared crusts, smoothing the tops with the back of a spoon. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to set.
Before serving, let the cheesecakes stand at room temperature for 10-15 minutes. Sprinkle chopped pistachios over the top. Enjoy the creamy, cool treat!

name: Mediterranean Chicken Souvlaki Bowls
description: Tender grilled chicken skewers served over a satisfying Greek salad with tomatoes, cucumber, olives and feta. Drizzled with creamy tzatziki and sprinkled with fresh herbs, these bowls bring all the flavors of the Mediterranean to your plate. Meal-prep friendly and family-approved!

instructions.description: In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and oregano. Add chicken and toss to coat. Cover and marinate 15 minutes.
Make-Ahead Tip: Marinate chicken up to 8 hours for deeper flavor. Store in fridge.
Thread chicken onto skewers. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 8-10 minutes, turning once, until charred and 165¬∞F internal temperature. Set aside.
In a large bowl, mix cucumber, tomatoes, olives, onion, feta, and parsley.
Divide greens between bowls. Top with chicken skewers and vegetable mixture. Drizzle with tzatziki.
Diet Hack: For extra crunch, add sliced bell peppers or jicama.
Refrigerate leftovers in airtight containers up to 4 days. Enjoy cold or reheat chicken skewers.

name: Pork Mince Stir-Fry with Vegetables
description: A flavorful and nutritious stir-fry with lean pork mince and an array of colorful vegetables.

instructions.description: Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
Wash and chop the bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, and broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic and ginger.
Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the minced garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add the pork mince and cook, breaking it up with a spatula, until browned and cooked through.
Add the chopped vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in the soy sauce and cook for another minute.
Serve the stir-fry over the cooked brown rice.

name: Tofu Protein Power Bites
description: These tasty no-bake bites pack a protein punch and make a great portable snack.

instructions.description: Press the tofu between paper towels for 15 minutes to remove excess liquid.
In a food processor, pulse the pressed tofu until crumbled.
Add the oats, hemp seeds, peanut butter, maple syrup, vanilla, and cinnamon. Pulse until well combined.
Roll the mixture into 6 balls. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up before eating.

name: Sizzling Steak Fajita Lettuce Wraps
description: Juicy spice-rubbed steak strips nestled in crisp lettuce cups with charred peppers and onions. A low-carb fiesta that's ready in under 30 minutes and tastes like an indulgent Taco Tuesday treat.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, mix chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Rub all over the steak.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steak and cook 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or to desired doneness. Transfer to a plate and let rest 5 minutes before slicing thinly against the grain.
In the same skillet, add peppers and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred and just tender, about 5 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt.
Assemble wraps: In each lettuce leaf, add a few steak slices, peppers and onions, diced avocado, and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over the top.

name: Chunky Monkey Granola Bars
description: Delicious and healthy gluten-free granola bars packed with bananas, dark chocolate, and nuts for a satisfying snack.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the gluten-free oats, mashed banana, almond butter, honey, chopped walnuts, dark chocolate chips, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well until evenly combined.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking pan and press it down firmly with a spatula or your hands to create an even layer.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the bars are set.
Allow the bars to cool completely in the pan before cutting into 7 equal-sized bars.

name: Ginger Garlic Shrimp Stir-Fry
description: Tender shrimp, crisp vegetables, and fragrant ginger-garlic sauce come together in this vibrant stir-fry. It's a one-pan wonder that's packed with satisfying protein and fiber. Perfect for a quick weeknight dinner that will have you looking forward to leftovers.

ingredients.name: medium shrimp, peeled and deveined (or cubed chicken breast)
mixed stir-fry vegetables (like broccoli, carrots, snow peas, bell peppers)
green onions, sliced (white and green parts)
avocado oil (or any high-heat cooking oil)
brown rice, cooked (or quinoa, cauliflower rice)

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook brown rice according to package directions. Can be done up to 3 days ahead and refrigerated.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and 1 tablespoon water. Set aside.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add avocado oil and swirl to coat.
Add shrimp to the hot pan in a single layer. Cook undisturbed for 2 minutes, until pink on the bottom.
Flip shrimp and add garlic, ginger, and white parts of green onions. Stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
Diet Hack: Push shrimp to the side of the pan. Add vegetables to the center and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender and bright in color.
Pour sauce over skillet and stir to combine all ingredients. Cook for 1 minute more until sauce is bubbling and slightly thickened.
Serve over brown rice, garnished with green onion tops. Enjoy!

name: Crispy Za'atar Chicken Thighs with Garlicky Spinach & Feta
description: Juicy chicken thighs crusted with aromatic za'atar spice, served over a bed of garlicky saut√©ed spinach and briny feta. Quick enough for a weeknight but special enough to serve to guests - they'd never guess it's low-carb!

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Season chicken generously with salt, pepper and 1 tablespoon za'atar spice. Rub all over to coat evenly.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken thighs skin-side down and cook undisturbed until skin is deep golden brown and crispy, 6-8 minutes.
Flip chicken thighs and transfer skillet to the preheated oven. Roast until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.
Return skillet to stove over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and minced garlic, stirring until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

Add spinach to skillet a few handfuls at a time, stirring until wilted before adding more. Cook until all spinach is wilted and liquid has evaporated, 3-4 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and remaining 1/2 tablespoon za'atar.
Divide garlicky greens between plates. Top with crispy za'atar chicken thighs, crumbled feta, and a squeeze of lemon. Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Thai Spiced Beef Jerky
description: A savory, protein-packed snack featuring lean beef seasoned with aromatic Thai spices and slowly dried for great flavor and texture.

instructions.description: Slice the beef into very thin strips, about 1/8 inch thick, cutting against the grain.
In a bowl, mix together the coconut aminos, fish sauce, garlic powder, ginger powder, lemongrass and cayenne pepper.
Add the beef strips to the marinade and mix well to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best flavor.
Preheat your oven to the lowest setting, around 170¬∞F (75¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Remove the beef from the marinade and lay the strips out in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Discard excess marinade.
Place the baking sheet in the oven and prop the door open slightly to allow air circulation. Dry the beef for 3-4 hours, or until completely dry and firm, flipping the strips halfway through.
Remove the beef jerky from the oven and allow to cool completely before storing in an airtight container. Enjoy as a protein-rich snack!

name: Mango Panna Cotta with Hazelnut Crumble
description: A creamy and indulgent panna cotta dessert infused with mango and topped with a crunchy hazelnut crumble.

instructions.description: Mix agar-agar powder with water and let sit for 5 minutes.
In a saucepan, combine cream and honey. Heat until just simmering.
Add agar-agar mixture to the saucepan and whisk until dissolved. Remove from heat.
Stir in mango puree and yogurt until smooth. Pour into a mold and chill for at least 4 hours.
For the crumble, roast hazelnuts at 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) for 8-10 minutes. Let cool and chop.
Mix chopped hazelnuts, oats, brown sugar, and butter until crumbly.
Bake crumble on a lined tray at 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) for 12-15 minutes until golden. Let cool.
Unmold the panna cotta, top with hazelnut crumble, and serve chilled.

name: Protein-Packed Edamame Hummus
description: A creamy, protein-rich hummus made with edamame, tahini, and spices. Perfect as a nutritious snack with veggies or crackers.

instructions.description: Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add frozen edamame and cook for 5 minutes until tender. Drain and let cool slightly.
In a food processor, combine cooked edamame, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, and salt. Pulse until roughly chopped.
With the food processor running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil and process until the hummus reaches a smooth, creamy consistency. Add 1-2 tbsp water if needed to thin out.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Transfer to a bowl and serve with raw veggies or crackers. Enjoy!

name: Herbed Quinoa Tabbouleh with Grilled Shrimp Skewers
description: This light yet filling Mediterranean tabbouleh features nutty quinoa tossed with bright herbs, juicy tomatoes, and crisp cucumbers. Served alongside succulent grilled shrimp skewers, it's a perfect protein-packed lunch to power you through the day.

instructions.description: In a small saucepan, bring quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender and water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, mint, green onions, olive oil, lemon juice, 1/4 tsp salt and a pinch of pepper. Add cooled quinoa and toss to combine.
Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. In a bowl, toss shrimp with garlic, paprika, remaining 1/4 tsp salt and pepper. Thread onto skewers.
Grill shrimp skewers until pink and lightly charred, about 2-3 minutes per side. Serve hot with the quinoa tabbouleh.

name: Pan-Seared Salmon with Quinoa and Vegetables
description: A healthy and easy lunch featuring savory pan-seared salmon, fluffy quinoa, and nutrient-packed vegetables.

instructions.description: Rinse the quinoa and cook according to package directions.
While the quinoa cooks, season the salmon with garlic powder, salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the salmon and cook for 3-4 minutes per side until browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the broccoli and red pepper. Saut√© for 5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Drizzle the salmon with lemon juice. Serve the salmon over the quinoa alongside the saut√©ed vegetables.

name: Cardamom Coconut Rice Pudding
description: A creamy, dairy-free Indian rice pudding infused with cardamom and topped with pistachios.

instructions.description: Rinse the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak rice in water for 20 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, combine the rice, coconut milk, water, jaggery, cardamom and saffron. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes until rice is tender and has absorbed the liquid.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes to thicken. Fluff with a fork.
Divide into bowls and garnish with chopped pistachios. Serve warm or chilled.

name: Easy Paleo Lemon Chicken Skillet
description: A simple one-pan dinner featuring juicy chicken thighs with asparagus and spinach in a zesty lemon sauce.

ingredients.name: asparagus spears, trimmed and cut in half

instructions.description: Season the chicken thighs with 1/4 tsp each salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic to skillet and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds.
Add asparagus, lemon zest, lemon juice, thyme, and remaining 1/4 tsp salt to skillet. Cook, stirring frequently, until asparagus is crisp-tender, 3-4 minutes.
Return chicken and any accumulated juices to skillet. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables
description: A nutritious and flavorful dinner featuring omega-3 rich salmon, protein-packed quinoa, and colorful roasted vegetables.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F (220¬∞C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Rinse the quinoa and cook it according to package instructions.
Cut the broccoli into bite-sized florets. Slice the red bell pepper and red onion into strips. Mince the garlic cloves.
In a large bowl, toss the broccoli, red bell pepper, red onion, and minced garlic with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp dried oregano, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
Spread the vegetables on the prepared baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly caramelized.

Season the salmon fillet with the remaining olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. Place the salmon on the baking sheet with the vegetables and bake for an additional 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and easily flakes with a fork.
Serve the baked salmon alongside the cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the dish before serving.

name: Spicy Tuna Edamame Wrap
description: A protein-packed snack wrap with spicy tuna salad and edamame hummus spread, perfect for a filling and nutritious snack.

instructions.description: In a food processor, blend the edamame, lemon juice, tahini, garlic, and salt until smooth to make the edamame hummus spread.
In a bowl, mix the drained tuna, Greek yogurt, and sriracha sauce until well combined.
Lay out the spinach wrap and spread a thick layer of edamame hummus over the entire surface.
Place the spicy tuna mixture in a line down the center of the wrap, leaving some space at the ends.
Fold in the sides of the wrap and roll it up tightly. Slice in half diagonally and serve.

name: Grilled Lemon Herb Halloumi Skewers
description: Satisfyingly meaty halloumi cheese skewers marinated in bright lemon and herbs, grilled until golden and served over a crisp Greek salad. Enjoy this restaurant-worthy dish at home in under 30 minutes - perfect for a filling weeknight meal or casual summer entertaining.

ingredients.name: red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper to make the marinade.
Add the halloumi cubes, zucchini, bell pepper and red onion to the bowl. Toss gently to coat evenly with the marinade. Let sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to infuse.
Meanwhile, heat a grill pan or outdoor grill over medium-high heat. Grease lightly with olive oil.
Thread the marinated halloumi and vegetables onto skewers, alternating ingredients. Reserve any remaining marinade.
Grill the skewers for 6-8 minutes total, turning occasionally, until the halloumi is golden brown and the vegetables are tender and lightly charred.
While the skewers cook, combine the romaine, tomatoes, cucumber, olives and fresh dill in a serving bowl. Drizzle with the reserved marinade and toss to coat.
Serve the hot grilled halloumi skewers over the crisp Greek salad. Enjoy immediately.

name: Asian-Inspired Egg Wrap with Fried Rice
description: A satisfying protein-packed breakfast wrap filled with savory fried rice and creamy eggs. Easily customizable with your favorite veggies, this make-ahead friendly dish will keep you energized all morning.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook rice in advance for quicker prep. Refrigerate until needed.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, soy sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper until well combined.
Heat sesame oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the rice, vegetables and green onion. Saut√© for 2-3 minutes until warmed through and any excess liquid evaporates.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan with the rice. Tilt the pan to spread it evenly. Cook undisturbed for 2 minutes until the egg sets around the edges.
Using a spatula, lift the edge of the egg and fold a third of it toward the center. Repeat on the other side, forming a wrap shape with the rice mixture inside.
Continue cooking 1-2 minutes more, flipping once, until the egg is fully set but not dry. Slide onto a plate and serve immediately. Enjoy!

name: Vietnamese Shaking Beef Breakfast Bowl
description: A flavorful and protein-packed Vietnamese-inspired breakfast bowl featuring tender shaking beef, soft-boiled eggs, and fresh vegetables.

instructions.description: Cut the sirloin steak into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together minced garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, and erythritol. Set aside.

Heat coconut oil in a skillet over high heat. Add the steak pieces and cook for 2-3 minutes per side or until browned. Pour the sauce over the steak and cook for an additional minute, shaking the pan to coat the steak evenly.
Meanwhile, bring a pot of water to a boil. Carefully lower the eggs into the water and cook for 6 minutes for soft-boiled. Remove the eggs and place them in an ice bath for 1 minute before peeling.
In a serving bowl, arrange baby spinach and sliced cucumber. Top with the cooked shaking beef and soft-boiled eggs. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Spicy Chickpea and Quinoa Bowl
description: A protein-packed, dairy-free lunch bowl with spicy chickpeas, quinoa, and fresh veggies.

instructions.description: Rinse and drain the canned chickpeas. In a bowl, mix the chickpeas with olive oil, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Dice the red bell pepper, cucumber, and red onion.
In a serving bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, spicy chickpeas, and diced vegetables. Drizzle with lemon juice and mix well.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa-Stuffed Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a savory quinoa and feta mixture, baked until tender and golden. Perfect for meal prep or an impressive packed lunch. Enjoy warm or at room temperature.

ingredients.name: bell peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Place halved bell peppers cut-side up in a baking dish. Drizzle with 1 tsp olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine quinoa and broth in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork.

Heat remaining 1 tsp oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook until softened, 3-4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, spinach, oregano, salt and pepper. Cook until spinach wilts, 1-2 minutes.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, vegetable mixture, feta and lemon juice. Spoon filling into the peppers. Bake until peppers are tender and filling is heated through, 10-15 minutes more.

name: Cinnamon-Spiced Baked Pears with Oat Crumble
description: Tender, juicy pears infused with warm cinnamon and topped with a crisp, nutty oat crumble. Ready in under 25 minutes, this single-serve dessert is a comforting treat you can feel good about enjoying any night of the week.

ingredients.name: medium ripe pear (Bosc or Bartlett work well)

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C). Halve the pear lengthwise and use a spoon to scoop out the core and seeds, creating a hollow.
In a small bowl, combine the oats, almond flour, chopped nuts, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt. Drizzle in the maple syrup and melted coconut oil. Mix until evenly moistened and crumbly.

Place the pear halves cut-side up in a small baking dish. Fill and mound the hollows with the oat mixture, pressing it in. Bake for 18-22 minutes, until the pears are tender and the topping is golden brown and crisp.
Let cool for 5 minutes before enjoying warm. Serve with a dollop of dairy-free coconut whipped cream if desired.

name: Turkey & Avocado Pita Pocket
description: A nutritious whole wheat pita stuffed with lean turkey, avocado, veggies and hummus for a filling and balanced meal.

instructions.description: Cut the pita in half to form two pockets. Gently open each pocket.
Spread 1 tbsp of hummus inside each pita half.
Thinly slice the tomato and cucumber. Slice the avocado.
Fill each pita with half of the turkey, avocado slices, tomato, cucumber and sprouts.

name: Thai Basil Chicken with Egg
description: A flavorful protein-packed Thai stir-fry with ground chicken, Thai basil and fried egg.

instructions.description: Mince the garlic and shallot. Chop the bell pepper into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
Heat some oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the ground chicken and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until browned.
Push the chicken to the side of the wok. Crack the eggs into the pan and scramble until set, about 2 minutes. Mix together with the chicken.
Add garlic, shallot, bell pepper, fish sauce, coconut aminos and chili flakes. Stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the Thai basil leaves. Serve hot.

name: Matcha Mochi Cakes with Ginger-Adzuki Cream
description: Chewy, earthy matcha mochi cakes filled with a luscious ginger-infused adzuki bean cream. These dairy-free, gluten-free treats are packed with antioxidants and fiber for a guilt-free indulgence.

instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease a 6-cup silicone muffin mold with oil.
In a bowl, sift together rice flour, matcha, sugar, and baking powder.
In a saucepan, combine almond milk, oil, and agar. Bring to a boil, whisking constantly, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Pour hot almond milk mixture into dry ingredients. Stir until a thick, sticky batter forms, about 1 minute.
Divide batter evenly into muffin molds, smoothing the tops. Bake until edges are lightly browned and cakes are springy to touch, 30-35 minutes.
Meanwhile, puree adzuki beans, ginger, and vanilla until smooth. Transfer to a saucepan and heat until thickened, stirring frequently, 5-7 minutes. Let cool.
When cakes are done, let cool in pan for 5 minutes before unmolding. Use a small knife to cut a slit in each and fill with adzuki cream. Serve warm.

name: Chocolate Hazelnut Panna Cotta
description: A creamy, indulgent panna cotta with rich chocolate and hazelnut flavors, perfect for a gluten-free Italian dessert.

instructions.description: Pour 60ml of the heavy cream into a small bowl and sprinkle the gelatin evenly over the surface. Let stand for 5 minutes to soften.
Combine the remaining heavy cream, milk, sugar and vanilla in a saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until steam appears and sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, add the chocolate, and whisk until melted and smooth. Whisk in the gelatin mixture until fully dissolved.
Divide the mixture evenly between two 6-ounce ramekins or dessert glasses. Refrigerate uncovered until cold, then cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight until set.
Before serving, toast and roughly chop the hazelnuts. Top each panna cotta with the hazelnuts. Serve chilled.

name: Mediterranean Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: Juicy grilled chicken, fluffy quinoa, and colorful veggies come together in this satisfying Mediterranean-inspired bowl. Make a big batch on Sunday for easy grab-and-go lunches all week.

instructions.description: Make-Ahead Tip: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Store cooled quinoa in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

Season the chicken breast with oregano, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat and brush with olive oil. Grill the chicken for 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through (internal temperature of 165¬∞F / 74¬∞C). Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before slicing.
In a large bowl, combine the sliced chicken, cooked quinoa, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and spinach.

In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and olive oil. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the chicken quinoa bowl and toss to combine. Diet Hack: Use fresh lemon to boost flavor without excess calories.
Transfer to a portable container and refrigerate until ready to eat. Enjoy chilled or at room temperature. Keeps well for up to 4 days in the fridge.

name: Savory Sweet Potato Paratha
description: A healthy and flavorful paleo-friendly Indian flatbread snack made with sweet potato and aromatic spices.

instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the mashed sweet potato, almond flour, coconut flour, cumin, coriander, garam masala, and salt. Mix well until a dough forms.
Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball.
Place one dough ball between two pieces of parchment paper and roll out into a thin, round flatbread.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1/4 tbsp of coconut oil. Cook the paratha for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.
Repeat steps 3 and 4 with the remaining dough balls.

name: Spicy Korean Pork Bibimbap Bowl
description: A fiery, flavorful bibimbap bowl with gochujang pork, vegetables, and a soft-boiled egg over rice.

instructions.description: Cook the rice according to package directions. Set aside.
In a bowl, mix the gochujang, soy sauce, minced garlic, and 1 tsp sesame oil. Slice the pork into thin strips and add to the marinade. Let sit for 20 minutes.
Julienne the carrot and zucchini. Slice the mushrooms. Blanch the bean sprouts and spinach separately, then shock in ice water.
Heat a pan over high heat and cook the marinated pork until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 tsp sesame oil and stir fry the carrot, zucchini and mushrooms until tender-crisp.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Gently add the egg and cook for 6 minutes. Remove and place in an ice bath, then carefully peel.
Assemble the bibimbap bowl: Place rice in a bowl and top with pork, cooked vegetables, bean sprouts, spinach, and kimchi. Place the soft-boiled egg on top. Serve immediately.

name: Vietnamese Beef and Egg Breakfast Bowl
description: A satisfying keto-friendly breakfast bowl with flavorful marinated beef, scrambled eggs, and fresh vegetables.

instructions.description: In a small bowl, whisk together fish sauce, lime juice, erythritol, and minced garlic. Pour over sliced flank steak in a shallow dish. Let marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated steak and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until browned. Transfer to a plate and let rest.
In the same skillet, scramble the eggs until set but still moist. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice the cucumber into thin matchsticks. Roughly chop the cilantro.
To assemble, place the scrambled eggs in a bowl. Top with sliced steak, bean sprouts, cucumber, and fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.

name: Prosciutto, Spinach & Quinoa Power Breakfast
description: A protein-packed, savory breakfast bowl featuring prosciutto, quinoa, spinach, and a poached egg, seasoned with thyme and garlic.

instructions.description: Rinse quinoa and cook according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut√© minced garlic and thyme for 1 minute.
Add spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Slice prosciutto into thin strips and crisp in a separate pan over medium-high heat, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Poach the egg in simmering water for 3-4 minutes.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, saut√©ed spinach, and crispy prosciutto. Top with the poached egg and season with additional salt and pepper to taste.

name: Keto Chocolate Mousse
description: A rich and creamy chocolate mousse that fits into a keto diet plan.

instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the heavy cream, cocoa powder, erythritol, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form, about 3-5 minutes.
Spoon or pipe the mixture into serving dishes. Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes before serving. Garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder or sugar-free chocolate shavings if desired.
